   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls which 'groups' are to run (with default values)
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_REG:         include
   27: %%         ESOCK_TEST_MON:         include
   28: %%         ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL:       include
   29: %%         ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE:  include
   30: %%         ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS:     include
   31: %%
   32: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   33: %%
   34: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   35: %%
   36: 
   37: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   38: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   39: %%
   40: %% Run a specific group:
   41: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   42: %%
   43: %% Run a specific test case:
   44: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   45: %%
   46: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   47: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   48: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   49: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   50: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   51: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   52: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   53: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   54: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   55: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   56: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   57: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   58: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   59: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   60: %%
   61: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   62: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   63: 
   64: 
   65: 
   66: -module(socket_SUITE).
   67: 
   68: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   69: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   70: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   71: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   72: 
   73: %% Suite exports
   74: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   75: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   76:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   77:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   78:

  182: 
  183: suite() ->
  184:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  185:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  186: 
  187: all() -> 
  188:     Groups = [{reg,          "ESOCK_TEST_REG",        include},
  189:               {monitor,      "ESOCK_TEST_MON",        include},
  190:               {ioctl,        "ESOCK_TEST_IOCTL",      include},
  191: 	      {socket_close, "ESOCK_TEST_SOCK_CLOSE", include},
  192: 	      {tickets,      "ESOCK_TEST_TICKETS",    include}],
  193:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  194: 
  195: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  196:     [];
  197: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  198:     [{group, Group}];
  199: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  200: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  201: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  202: 		[{group, Group}];
  203: 	    false ->
  204: 		[];
  205: 	    Val ->
  206: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  207: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  208: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  209: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  210: 			[{group, Group}];
  211: 		    _ ->
  212: 			[]
  213: 		end
  214: 	end.
  215:     
  216: 
  217: groups() -> 
  218:     [{reg,                         [], reg_simple_cases()},
  219: 
  220:      {monitor,                     [], monitor_cases()},
  221: 
  222:      {socket_close,                [], socket_close_cases()},
  223:      {sc_ctrl_proc_exit,           [], sc_cp_exit_cases()},
  224:      {sc_local_close,              [], sc_lc_cases()},
  225:      {sc_remote_close,             [], sc_rc_cases()},
  226:      {sc_remote_shutdown,          [], sc_rs_cases()},
  227: 
  228:      {ioctl,                       [], ioctl_cases()},
  229:      {ioctl_simple,                [], ioctl_simple_cases()},
  230:      {ioctl_get,                   [], ioctl_get_cases()},
  231:      {ioctl_set,                   [], ioctl_set_cases()},
  232: 
  233:      %% Ticket groups
  234:      {tickets,                     [], tickets_cases()},
  235:      {otp16359,                    [], otp16359_cases()},
  236:      {otp18240,                    [], otp18240_cases()}
  237:     ].
  238:

  398: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  399:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  400:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  401:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  402:     
  403:     try socket:info() of
  404:         #{} ->
  405:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  406:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  407:                     SKIP;
  408: 
  409:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  410: 
  411:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  412:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  413: 
  414:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
  415:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  416: 
  417:                     socket:use_registry(false),
  418:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
  419:                         default ->
  420:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
  421:                                 ok ->
  422:                                     Config1;
  423:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  424:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  425:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  426:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  427:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  428:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  429:                             end;
  430:                         Quiet ->
  431:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
  432:                                 ok ->
  433:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
  434:                                 {error, Reason} ->
  435:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
  436:                                        "Failed starting logger"
  437:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
  438:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
  439:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
  440:                             end
  441:                     end
  442:             end
  443:     catch
  444:         error : notsup ->
  445:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  446:         error : undef ->
  447:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  448:     end.
  449: 
  450: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  451: 
  452:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  453:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  454:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  455: 
  456:     %% Stop the local monitor
  457:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  458: 
  459:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
  460: 
  461:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  462: 
  463:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  464:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  465: 
  466:     Config1.
  467: 
  468: 
  469: init_per_group(GroupName, Config)
  470:   when (GroupName =:= sc_remote_close) orelse
  471:        (GroupName =:= sc_remote_shutdown) ->
  472:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
  473:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  474:               "~n", [GroupName, Config]),
  475:     %% Maybe we should skip the entire suite for this platform,
  476:     %% but for now we just skip these groups, which seem to 
  477:     %% have problems (node start).
  478:     %% As stated elsewhere, its not really Fedora 16, but 
  479:     %% the *really* slow VM that is the issue.
  480:     try is_old_fedora16() of
  481:         ok ->
  482:             Config
  483:     catch
  484:         throw:{skip, _} = SKIP ->
  485:             SKIP
  486:     end;
  487: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  488:     Config.
  489: 
  490: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  491:     Config.
  492: 
  493: 
  494: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  495:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
  496:               "~n   Config: ~p"
  497:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
  498:     Config.
  499: 
  500: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  501:     Config.
  502: 
  503: 
  504: quiet_mode(Config) ->
  505:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
  506:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
  507:             Quiet;
  508:         false ->
  509:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
  510:                 "true"  -> true;
  511:                 "false" -> false;
  512:                 _       -> default
  513:             end
  514:     end.
  515: 
  516: 
  517: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  518: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  519: %%                                                                     %%
  520: %%                             REGISTRY                                %%
  521: %%                                                                     %%
  522: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  523: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  524: 
  525: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  526: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  527: %% has the correct info.
  528: 
  529: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  530:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  531:     tc_try(reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count,
  532:            fun() ->
  533:                    ok = reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count()
  534:            end).
  535: 
  536: 
  537: reg_s_single_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  538:     socket:use_registry(true),
  539: 
  540:     {OS, _} = os:type(),
  541: 
  542:     %% We may have some sockets already existing.
  543:     %% Make sure we dont count them when we test.
  544:     Existing = socket:which_sockets(),
  545:     N = length(Existing),
  546:     SupportsIPV6 =
  547:         case (catch has_support_ipv6()) of
  548:             ok ->
  549:                 true;
  550:             _ ->
  551:                 false
  552:         end,
  553:     SupportsLOCAL =
  554:         case (catch has_support_unix_domain_socket()) of
  555:             ok ->
  556:                 true;
  557:             _ ->
  558:                 false
  559:         end,
  560:     SupportsSCTP =
  561:         case (catch has_support_sctp()) of
  562:             ok ->
  563:                 true;
  564:             _ ->
  565:                 false
  566:         end,
  567:     InitSockInfos =
  568:         [
  569:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  570:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  571:         ] ++
  572:         case SupportsIPV6 of
  573:             true ->
  574:                 [
  575:                  {inet6, stream, tcp},
  576:                  {inet6, dgram,  udp}
  577:                 ];
  578:             false ->
  579:                 []
  580:         end ++
  581:         case SupportsLOCAL of
  582:             true when (OS =/= win32) ->
  583:                 [
  584:                  {local, stream, default},
  585:                  {local, dgram,  default}
  586:                 ];
  587:             true ->
  588:                 [
  589:                  {local, stream, default}
  590:                 ];
  591:             false ->
  592:                 []
  593:         end ++
  594:         [
  595:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  596:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  597:         ] ++
  598:         case SupportsSCTP of
  599:             true ->
  600:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  601:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  602:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  603:                 case socket:open(inet,
  604:                                  seqpacket,
  605:                                  sctp,
  606:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  607:                     {ok, S} ->
  608:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  609:                         (catch socket:close(S)),
  610:                         [
  611:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp},
  612:                          {inet, seqpacket, sctp}
  613:                         ];
  614:                     {error, _} ->
  615:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  616:                         []
  617:                 end;
  618:             false ->
  619:                 []
  620:         end ++
  621:         [
  622:          {inet, stream, tcp},
  623:          {inet, dgram,  udp}
  624:         ] ++
  625:         case SupportsSCTP andalso SupportsIPV6 of
  626:             true ->
  627:                 %% On some platforms this is not enough,
  628:                 %% we need to actually check this "by doing it"...
  629:                 ?P("test open sctp socket"),
  630:                 case socket:open(inet6,
  631:                                  seqpacket,
  632:                                  sctp,
  633:                                  #{use_registry => false}) of
  634:                     {ok, S6} ->
  635:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: success"),
  636:                         (catch socket:close(S6)),
  637:                         [
  638:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp},
  639:                          {inet6, seqpacket, sctp}
  640:                         ];
  641:                     {error, _} ->
  642:                         ?P("test open sctp socket: failed"),
  643:                         []
  644:                 end;
  645:             false ->
  646:                 []
  647:         end,
  648: 
  649:     i("open sockets"),
  650:     Socks =
  651:         [fun({Domain, Type, Proto}) ->
  652:                  i("open socket: ~w, ~w, ~w", [Domain, Type, Proto]),
  653:                  {ok, Sock} = socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto),
  654:                  Sock
  655:          end(InitSockInfo) || InitSockInfo <- InitSockInfos],
  656: 
  657:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  658: 
  659: 
  660:     %% **** Total Number Of Sockets ****
  661: 
  662:     NumSocks1 = N + length(Socks),
  663:     NumberOf1 = socket:number_of(),
  664: 
  665:     i("verify (total) number of sockets(1): ~w, ~w",
  666:       [NumSocks1, NumberOf1]),
  667:     case (NumSocks1 =:= NumberOf1) of
  668:         true ->
  669:             ok;
  670:         false ->
  671:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets1, {NumSocks1, NumberOf1})
  672:     end,
  673: 
  674: 
  675:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 TCP Sockets ****
  676: 
  677:     %% inet, stream, tcp
  678:     SiNumTCP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, stream, tcp),
  679:     SrNumTCP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, stream, tcp),
  680: 
  681:     i("verify number of IPv4 TCP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP]),
  682:     case (SiNumTCP =:= SrNumTCP) of
  683:         true ->
  684:             ok;
  685:         false ->
  686:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_tcp_sockets, {SiNumTCP, SrNumTCP})
  687:     end,
  688: 
  689: 
  690:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 UDP Sockets ****
  691: 
  692:     %% inet, dgram, udp
  693:     SiNumUDP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, dgram, udp),
  694:     SrNumUDP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, dgram, udp),
  695: 
  696:     i("verify number of IPv4 UDP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP]),
  697:     case (SiNumUDP =:= SrNumUDP) of
  698:         true ->
  699:             ok;
  700:         false ->
  701:             exit({wrong_number_of_ipv4_udp_sockets, SiNumUDP, SrNumUDP})
  702:     end,
  703: 
  704: 
  705:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 SCTP Sockets ****
  706: 
  707:     %% inet, seqpacket, sctp
  708:     SiNumSCTP = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  709:     SrNumSCTP = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet, seqpacket, sctp),
  710: 
  711:     i("verify number of IPv4 SCTP sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP]),
  712:     case (SiNumSCTP =:= SrNumSCTP) of
  713:         true ->
  714:             ok;
  715:         false ->
  716:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sctp_sockets, {SiNumSCTP, SrNumSCTP})
  717:     end,
  718: 
  719: 
  720:     %% **** Number Of IPv4 Sockets ****
  721: 
  722:     %% inet
  723:     SiNumINET = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet),
  724:     SrNumINET = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet),
  725: 
  726:     i("verify number of IPv4 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET, SrNumINET]),
  727:     case (SiNumINET =:= SrNumINET) of
  728:         true ->
  729:             ok;
  730:         false ->
  731:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv4_sockets, {SiNumINET, SrNumINET})
  732:     end,
  733: 
  734: 
  735:     %% **** Number Of IPv6 Sockets ****
  736: 
  737:     %% inet6
  738:     SiNumINET6 = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, inet6),
  739:     SrNumINET6 = reg_sr_num(Existing, inet6),
  740: 
  741:     i("verify number of IPv6 sockets: ~w, ~w", [SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6]),
  742:     case (SiNumINET6 =:= SrNumINET6) of
  743:         true ->
  744:             ok;
  745:         false ->
  746:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_ipv6_sockets, {SiNumINET6, SrNumINET6})
  747:     end,
  748: 
  749: 
  750:     %% **** Number Of Unix Domain Sockets Sockets ****
  751: 
  752:     %% local
  753:     SiNumLOCAL = reg_si_num(InitSockInfos, local),
  754:     SrNumLOCAL = reg_sr_num(Existing, local),
  755: 
  756:     i("verify number of Unix Domain Sockets sockets: ~w, ~w",
  757:       [SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL]),
  758:     case (SiNumLOCAL =:= SrNumLOCAL) of
  759:         true ->
  760:             ok;
  761:         false ->
  762:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_local_sockets, {SiNumLOCAL, SrNumLOCAL})
  763:     end,
  764: 
  765: 
  766:     %% **** Close *all* Sockets then verify Number Of Sockets ****
  767: 
  768:     i("close sockets"),
  769:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  770:                           i("close socket"),                          
  771:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  772:                   end, Socks),
  773: 
  774:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  775: 
  776:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  777: 
  778:     i("verify number of sockets(2): ~w, ~w", [N, NumberOf2]),
  779:     case (N =:= NumberOf2) of
  780:         true ->
  781:             ok;
  782:         false ->
  783:             reg_si_fail(wrong_number_of_sockets2, {N, NumberOf2})
  784:     end,
  785: 
  786: 
  787:     i("verify owner sockets (none)", []),
  788:     Expected1 = [],
  789:     case socket:which_sockets(self()) of
  790:         Expected1 ->
  791:             ok;
  792:         Unexpected1 ->
  793:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own1, {Expected1, Unexpected1})
  794:     end,
  795: 
  796:     i("create some sockets", []),
  797:     OwnSockets = lists:sort(
  798:                    [fun({D, T})->
  799:                             i("create ~w:~w socket", [D, T]),
  800:                             {ok, OSocks} = socket:open(D, T, default),
  801:                             OSocks
  802:                     end(SockInfo) || SockInfo <-
  803:                                          [{inet, dgram},
  804:                                           {inet, dgram},
  805:                                           {inet, stream},
  806:                                           {inet, stream}]]),
  807: 
  808:     i("verify owner sockets (~w)", [length(OwnSockets)]),
  809:     case lists:sort(socket:which_sockets(self())) of
  810:         OwnSockets ->
  811:             ok;
  812:         Unexpected2 ->
  813:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets_own2, {OwnSockets, Unexpected2})
  814:     end,
  815: 
  816:     i("close (own) sockets"),
  817:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
  818:                           i("close socket"),                          
  819:                           ok = socket:close(S)
  820:                   end, OwnSockets),
  821:     ?SLEEP(1000),
  822: 
  823:     i("verify number of sockets(2) (again)"),
  824:     NumberOf2 = socket:number_of(),
  825: 
  826:     i("verify pre-existing sockets(2)", []),
  827:     case socket:which_sockets() of
  828:         Existing ->
  829:             ok;
  830:         OtherSockets ->
  831:             reg_si_fail(wrong_sockets2, {Existing, OtherSockets})
  832:     end,
  833: 
  834:     socket:use_registry(false),
  835:     ok.
  836: 
  837: 
  838: reg_si_fail(Reason, Extra) ->
  839:     socket:use_registry(false),
  840:     exit({Reason, Extra}).
  841: 
  842: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain)
  843:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6) orelse (Domain =:= local)) ->
  844:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  845: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Type)
  846:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  847:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined);
  848: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Proto)
  849:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  850:     reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto).
  851: 
  852: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  853:     F = fun({D, _T, _P}) when (D =:= Domain) -> true;
  854:            (_) -> false
  855:         end,
  856:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  857: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, Type, undefined) ->
  858:     F = fun({_D, T, _P}) when (T =:= Type) -> true;
  859:            (_) -> false
  860:         end,
  861:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  862: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, undefined, undefined, Proto) ->
  863:     F = fun({_D, _T, P}) when (P =:= Proto) -> true;
  864:            (_) -> false
  865:         end,
  866:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo);
  867: reg_si_num(SocksInfo, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  868:     F = fun({D, T, P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  869:                             (T =:= Type) andalso
  870:                             (P =:= Proto) ->
  871:                 true;
  872:            (_) ->
  873:                 false
  874:         end,
  875:     reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo).
  876: 
  877: reg_si_num2(F, SocksInfo) ->
  878:     length(lists:filter(F, SocksInfo)).
  879: 
  880: 
  881: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  882:   when ((Domain =:= inet) orelse (Domain =:= inet6)) ->
  883:     length(socket:which_sockets(Domain) -- Existing);
  884: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain)
  885:   when (Domain =:= local) ->
  886:     reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined);
  887: reg_sr_num(Existing, Type)
  888:   when ((Type =:= stream) orelse (Type =:= dgram) orelse (Type =:= seqpacket)) ->
  889:     length(socket:which_sockets(Type) -- Existing);
  890: reg_sr_num(Existing, Proto)
  891:   when ((Proto =:= sctp) orelse (Proto =:= tcp) orelse (Proto =:= udp)) ->
  892:     length(socket:which_sockets(Proto) -- Existing).
  893: 
  894: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, undefined, undefined) ->
  895:     F = fun(#{domain := D}) when (D =:= Domain) ->
  896:                 true;
  897:            (_X) ->
  898:                 false
  899:         end,
  900:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F);
  901: reg_sr_num(Existing, Domain, Type, Proto) ->
  902:     F = fun(#{domain   := D,
  903:               type     := T,
  904:               protocol := P}) when (D =:= Domain) andalso
  905:                                    (T =:= Type) andalso
  906:                                    (P =:= Proto) ->
  907:                 true;
  908:            (_X) ->
  909:                 %% i("reg_sr_num -> not counting: "
  910:                 %%   "~n   ~p", [_X]),
  911:                 false
  912:         end,
  913:     reg_sr_num2(Existing, F).
  914: 
  915: reg_sr_num2(Existing, F) ->
  916:     length(socket:which_sockets(F) -- Existing).
  917: 
  918: 
  919: 
  920: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  921: %% We create a bunch of different sockets and ensure that the registry
  922: %% has the correct info.
  923: 
  924: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  925:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
  926:     tc_try(reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count,
  927:            fun() ->
  928:                    ok = reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count()
  929:            end).
  930: 
  931: 
  932: reg_s_optional_open_and_close_and_count() ->
  933:     i("Make sure use of socket registry is enabled (regardless of default)"),
  934:     socket:use_registry(true),
  935:     #{use_registry := true} = socket:info(),
  936: 
  937:     i("get current socket base count"),
  938:     Base = socket:number_of(),
  939: 
  940:     i("create a socket and ensure its counted"),
  941:     {ok, S1} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
  942:     Base1 = Base + 1,
  943:     case socket:number_of() of
  944:         Base1 ->
  945:             ok;
  946:         Invalid1 -> 
  947:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets1, Invalid1, Base + 1})
  948:     end,
  949:     i("close the socket and ensure its counted (back to base)"),
  950:     ok = socket:close(S1),
  951:     case socket:number_of() of
  952:         Base ->
  953:             ok;
  954:         Invalid2 -> 
  955:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets2, Invalid2, Base})
  956:     end,
  957: 
  958:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly off "
  959:       "and ensure its not counted"),
  960:     {ok, S2} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => false}),
  961:     case socket:number_of() of
  962:         Base ->
  963:             ok;
  964:         Invalid3 -> 
  965:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets3, Invalid3, Base})
  966:     end,
  967:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
  968:     ok = socket:close(S2),
  969:     case socket:number_of() of
  970:         Base ->
  971:             ok;
  972:         Invalid4 -> 
  973:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets4, Invalid4, Base})
  974:     end,
  975: 
  976:     i("Globally disable use of registry"),
  977:     socket:use_registry(false),
  978:     #{use_registry := false} = socket:info(),
  979:     i("create a socket and ensure its not counted"),
  980:     {ok, S3} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp),
  981:     case socket:number_of() of
  982:         Base ->
  983:             ok;
  984:         Invalid5 -> 
  985:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets5, Invalid5, Base})
  986:     end,
  987:     i("close the socket and ensure its not counted"),
  988:     ok = socket:close(S3),
  989:     case socket:number_of() of
  990:         Base ->
  991:             ok;
  992:         Invalid6 -> 
  993:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets6, Invalid6, Base})
  994:     end,
  995: 
  996:     i("create a socket with use_registry explicitly on "
  997:       "and ensure its counted"),
  998:     {ok, S4} = socket:open(inet, dgram, udp, #{use_registry => true}),
  999:     case socket:number_of() of
 1000:         Base1 ->
 1001:             ok;
 1002:         Invalid7 -> 
 1003:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets7, Invalid7, Base + 1})
 1004:     end,
 1005:     i("close the socket and ensure counted (back to base)"),
 1006:     ok = socket:close(S4),
 1007:     case socket:number_of() of
 1008:         Base ->
 1009:             ok;
 1010:         Invalid8 -> 
 1011:             exit({wrong_number_of_sockets8, Invalid8, Base})
 1012:     end,
 1013: 
 1014:     socket:use_registry(false),
 1015:     i("done"),
 1016:     ok.
 1017:

 1019: 
 1020: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1021: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1022: %%                                                                     %%
 1023: %%                       SOCKET MONITOR                                %%
 1024: %%                                                                     %%
 1025: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1026: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1027: 
 1028: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1029: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then close socket.
 1030: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1031: 
 1032: monitor_simple_open_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1033:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1034:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_close,
 1035:            fun() ->
 1036: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1037:                                  type     => stream,
 1038:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1039:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState)
 1040:            end).
 1041: 
 1042: 
 1043: mon_simple_open_and_close(InitState) ->
 1044:     OwnerSeq =
 1045:         [
 1046:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1047:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1048:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1049:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1050:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1051:                    end},
 1052:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1053:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1054:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1055:                            ok
 1056:                    end},
 1057: 
 1058:          %% *** Init part ***
 1059:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1060:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1061:                          type     := Type, 
 1062:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1063:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1064:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1065:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1066:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1067:                                    ERROR
 1068:                            end
 1069:                    end},
 1070:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1071:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1072:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1073:                            ok
 1074:                    end},
 1075: 
 1076:          %% The actual test
 1077:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1078:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1079:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1080:                    end},
 1081: 
 1082:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1083:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1084:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1085: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1086:                    end},
 1087: 
 1088:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1089:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1090:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1091:                                ok ->
 1092:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1093:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1094:                                    ERROR
 1095:                            end
 1096:                    end},
 1097: 
 1098:          %% *** We are done ***
 1099:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1100:         ],
 1101: 
 1102:     TesterSeq =
 1103:         [
 1104:          %% *** Init part ***
 1105:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1106:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1107:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1108:                            ok
 1109:                    end},
 1110:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1111:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1112:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1113:                            ok
 1114:                    end},
 1115:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1116:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1117:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1118:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1119:                    end},
 1120:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1121:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1122: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1123: 			   ok
 1124:                    end},
 1125:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1126:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1127: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1128: 			   ok
 1129:                    end},
 1130:          #{desc => "monitor socket - create two",
 1131:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1132:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1133:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1134: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor(s): "
 1135: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 1136: 				       "~n   2: ~p", [MRef1, MRef2]),
 1137: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1, mon2 => MRef2}}
 1138:                    end},
 1139:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 1140:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1141: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1142: 			   ok
 1143:                    end},
 1144:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 1145:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1146: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1147: 			   ok
 1148:                    end},
 1149:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (self) two",
 1150:            cmd  => fun(#{mon1 := MRef1,
 1151: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1152: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1153: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(self())) of
 1154: 			       Mons ->
 1155: 				   ok;
 1156: 			       SMons ->
 1157: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (self) monitors: "
 1158: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1159: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1160: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1161: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1162: 			   end
 1163:                    end},
 1164:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - (sock) two",
 1165:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1166: 			 mon1 := MRef1,
 1167: 			 mon2 := MRef2} = _State) ->
 1168: 			   Mons = lists:sort([MRef1, MRef2]),
 1169: 			   case lists:sort(socket:which_monitors(Sock)) of
 1170: 			       Mons ->
 1171: 				   ok;
 1172: 			       SMons ->
 1173: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected (sock) monitors: "
 1174: 					       "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1175: 					       "~n   Actual:   ~p",
 1176: 					       [Mons, SMons]),
 1177: 				   {error, unexpected_monitors}
 1178: 			   end
 1179:                    end},
 1180:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1181:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1182: 			   Self   = self(),
 1183: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1184: 			   ok
 1185:                    end},
 1186: 
 1187:          %% The actual test
 1188:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1189:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1190:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1191:                            ok
 1192:                    end},
 1193:          #{desc => "await socket down 1",
 1194:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1195: 			 mon1 := MRef} = State) ->
 1196: 			   receive
 1197: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1198: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1199: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1200: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1201: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1202: 					       [MRef,
 1203: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1204: 						Info]),
 1205: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon1, State)}
 1206: 			   after 5000 ->
 1207: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1208: 				   {error, timeout}
 1209: 			   end
 1210:                    end},
 1211:          #{desc => "await socket down 2",
 1212:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1213: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 1214: 			   receive
 1215: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1216: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1217: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1218: 					       "~n      Socket: ~s"
 1219: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1220: 					       [MRef,
 1221: 						socket:to_list(Sock),
 1222: 						Info]),
 1223: 				   {ok, maps:remove(mon2, State)}
 1224: 			   after 5000 ->
 1225: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1226: 				   {error, timeout}
 1227: 			   end
 1228:                    end},
 1229:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1230:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1231: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1232: 			   ok
 1233:                    end},
 1234:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1235:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1236: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1237: 			   ok
 1238:                    end},
 1239:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1240:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1241: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1242: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1243: 			   ok
 1244:                    end},
 1245:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1246:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1247: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1248: 			   ok
 1249:                    end},
 1250: 
 1251:          %% Cleanup
 1252:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1253:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1254:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1255:                            ok
 1256:                    end},
 1257: 
 1258:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1259:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1260:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1261:                                ok ->
 1262:                                    ok;
 1263:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1264:                                    ERROR
 1265:                            end
 1266:                    end},
 1267: 
 1268:          %% *** We are done ***
 1269:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1270:         ],
 1271: 
 1272:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1273:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1274: 
 1275:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1276:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1277:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1278: 
 1279:     i("await evaluator"),
 1280:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1281: 
 1282: 
 1283: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1284: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process then stop the
 1285: %% owner process.
 1286: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1287: 
 1288: monitor_simple_open_and_exit(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1289:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1290:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_exit,
 1291:            fun() ->
 1292: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1293:                                  type     => stream,
 1294:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1295:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState)
 1296:            end).
 1297: 
 1298: 
 1299: mon_simple_open_and_exit(InitState) ->
 1300:     OwnerSeq =
 1301:         [
 1302:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1303:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1304:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1305:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1306:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1307:                    end},
 1308:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1309:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1310:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1311:                            ok
 1312:                    end},
 1313: 
 1314:          %% *** Init part ***
 1315:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1316:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1317:                          type     := Type, 
 1318:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1319:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1320:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1321:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1322:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1323:                                    ERROR
 1324:                            end
 1325:                    end},
 1326:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1327:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1328:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1329:                            ok
 1330:                    end},
 1331: 
 1332:          %% The actual test
 1333:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1334:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1335:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1336:                                ok ->
 1337:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1338:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1339:                                    ERROR
 1340:                            end
 1341:                    end},
 1342: 
 1343:          %% *** We are done ***
 1344:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1345:         ],
 1346: 
 1347:     TesterSeq =
 1348:         [
 1349:          %% *** Init part ***
 1350:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1351:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1352:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1353:                            ok
 1354:                    end},
 1355:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1356:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1357:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1358:                            ok
 1359:                    end},
 1360:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1361:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1362:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1363:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1364:                    end},
 1365:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1366:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1367: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1368: 			   ok
 1369:                    end},
 1370:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1371:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1372: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1373: 			   ok
 1374:                    end},
 1375:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1376:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1377:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1378: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1379: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1380:                    end},
 1381:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1382:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1383: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1384: 			   ok
 1385:                    end},
 1386:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1387:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1388: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1389: 			   ok
 1390:                    end},
 1391:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1392:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1393: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1394: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1395: 			   [MRef] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1396: 			   ok
 1397:                    end},
 1398:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - only us",
 1399:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1400: 			   Self   = self(),
 1401: 			   [Self] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1402: 			   ok
 1403:                    end},
 1404: 
 1405:          %% The actual test
 1406:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1407:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1408:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1409:                            ok
 1410:                    end},
 1411:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1412:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1413:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1414:                                ok ->
 1415:                                    ok;
 1416:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1417:                                    ERROR
 1418:                            end
 1419:                    end},
 1420: 
 1421:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1422:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 1423: 			 mon  := MRef} = _State) ->
 1424: 			   receive
 1425: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1426: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 1427: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1428: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1429: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1430: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1431: 				   ok
 1432: 			   after 5000 ->
 1433: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 1434: 				   {error, timeout}
 1435: 			   end
 1436:                    end},
 1437:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1438:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1439: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1440: 			   ok
 1441:                    end},
 1442:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1443:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1444: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1445: 			   ok
 1446:                    end},
 1447:          #{desc => "verify which monitors - only one",
 1448:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1449: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(self()),
 1450: 			   [] = socket:which_monitors(Sock),
 1451: 			   ok
 1452:                    end},
 1453:          #{desc => "verify monitored by - none",
 1454:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1455: 			   [] = socket:monitored_by(Sock),
 1456: 			   ok
 1457:                    end},
 1458: 
 1459:          %% *** We are done ***
 1460:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1461:         ],
 1462: 
 1463:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1464:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1465: 
 1466:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1467:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1468:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1469: 
 1470:     i("await evaluator"),
 1471:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1472: 
 1473: 
 1474: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1475: %% Create one socket, monitor from a different process, cancel_montor
 1476: %% (demonitor) and then close socket.
 1477: %% The process that did the monitor shall *not* receive a socket DOWN.
 1478: 
 1479: monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1480:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1481:     tc_try(monitor_simple_open_and_demon_and_close,
 1482:            fun() ->
 1483: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1484:                                  type     => stream,
 1485:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1486:                    ok = mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState)
 1487:            end).
 1488: 
 1489: 
 1490: mon_simple_open_and_demon_and_close(InitState) ->
 1491:     OwnerSeq =
 1492:         [
 1493:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1494:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1495:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1496:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1497:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1498:                    end},
 1499:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1500:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1501:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1502:                            ok
 1503:                    end},
 1504: 
 1505:          %% *** Init part ***
 1506:          #{desc => "create socket",
 1507:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1508:                          type     := Type, 
 1509:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1510:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1511:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1512:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 1513:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1514:                                    ERROR
 1515:                            end
 1516:                    end},
 1517:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 1518:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1519:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 1520:                            ok
 1521:                    end},
 1522: 
 1523:          %% The actual test
 1524:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 1525:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 1526:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 1527:                    end},
 1528: 
 1529:          #{desc => "close socket",
 1530:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1531:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 1532: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 1533:                    end},
 1534: 
 1535:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 1536:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 1537:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 1538:                                ok ->
 1539:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 1540:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1541:                                    ERROR
 1542:                            end
 1543:                    end},
 1544: 
 1545:          %% *** We are done ***
 1546:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1547:         ],
 1548: 
 1549:     TesterSeq =
 1550:         [
 1551:          %% *** Init part ***
 1552:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 1553:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 1554:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 1555:                            ok
 1556:                    end},
 1557:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 1558:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1559:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 1560:                            ok
 1561:                    end},
 1562:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 1563:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 1564:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 1565:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 1566:                    end},
 1567:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1568:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1569: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1570: 			   ok
 1571:                    end},
 1572:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1573:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1574: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1575: 			   ok
 1576:                    end},
 1577:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 1578:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 1579:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 1580: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitor: ~p", [MRef]),
 1581: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 1582:                    end},
 1583:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 1584:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1585: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1586: 			   ok
 1587:                    end},
 1588:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 1589:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1590: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1591: 			   ok
 1592:                    end},
 1593: 
 1594:          %% The actual test
 1595:          #{desc => "demonitor socket",
 1596:            cmd  => fun(#{mon := MRef} = State) ->
 1597:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 1598: 			   {ok, maps:remove(mon, State)}
 1599:                    end},
 1600: 
 1601: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 1602: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1603: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 1604: 			   ok
 1605: 		   end},
 1606: 	 #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 1607: 	   cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 1608: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 1609: 			   ok
 1610: 		   end},
 1611: 
 1612:          #{desc => "order owner to close",
 1613:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1614:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 1615:                            ok
 1616:                    end},
 1617: 
 1618:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 1619:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 1620: 			   receive
 1621: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 1622: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("received UNEXPECTED down: "
 1623: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 1624: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 1625: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 1626: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 1627: 				   {error, unexpected_down}
 1628: 			   after 5000 ->
 1629: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("expected socket down timeout"),
 1630: 				   ok
 1631: 			   end
 1632:                    end},
 1633: 
 1634:          %% Cleanup
 1635:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 1636:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1637:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 1638:                            ok
 1639:                    end},
 1640: 
 1641:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 1642:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 1643:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 1644:                                ok ->
 1645:                                    ok;
 1646:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1647:                                    ERROR
 1648:                            end
 1649:                    end},
 1650: 
 1651:          %% *** We are done ***
 1652:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 1653:         ],
 1654: 
 1655:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 1656:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 1657: 
 1658:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 1659:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 1660:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 1661: 
 1662:     i("await evaluator"),
 1663:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 1664:

 1667: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then close
 1668: %% socket. The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 1669: 
 1670: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 1671:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 1672:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks,
 1673:            fun() ->
 1674: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 1675:                                  type     => stream,
 1676:                                  protocol => tcp},
 1677:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 1678:            end).
 1679: 
 1680: 
 1681: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 1682:     OwnerSeq =
 1683:         [
 1684:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 1685:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 1686:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 1687:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 1688:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 1689:                    end},
 1690:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 1691:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 1692:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1693:                            ok
 1694:                    end},
 1695: 
 1696:          %% *** Init part ***
 1697:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 1698:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1699:                          type     := Type, 
 1700:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1701:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1702:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1703:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 1704:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1705:                                    ERROR
 1706:                            end
 1707:                    end},
 1708:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 1709:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1710:                          type     := Type, 
 1711:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1712:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1713:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1714:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 1715:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1716:                                    ERROR
 1717:                            end
 1718:                    end},
 1719:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 1720:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1721:                          type     := Type, 
 1722:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1723:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1724:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1725:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 1726:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1727:                                    ERROR
 1728:                            end
 1729:                    end},
 1730:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 1731:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1732:                          type     := Type, 
 1733:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1734:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1735:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1736:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 1737:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1738:                                    ERROR
 1739:                            end
 1740:                    end},
 1741:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 1742:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 1743:                          type     := Type, 
 1744:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 1745:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 1746:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 1747:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 1748:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 1749:                                    ERROR
 1750:                            end
 1751:                    end},

 1753:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 1754: 			 sock1  := Sock1,

 1761:                            ok

 2106: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2107: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process then exit
 2108: %% the owner process.
 2109: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2110: 
 2111: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2112:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2113:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks,
 2114:            fun() ->
 2115: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2116:                                  type     => stream,
 2117:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2118:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState)
 2119:            end).
 2120: 
 2121: 
 2122: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2123:     OwnerSeq =
 2124:         [
 2125:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2126:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2127:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2128:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2129:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2130:                    end},
 2131:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2132:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2133:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2134:                            ok
 2135:                    end},
 2136: 
 2137:          %% *** Init part ***
 2138:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2139:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2140:                          type     := Type, 
 2141:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2142:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2143:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2144:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2145:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2146:                                    ERROR
 2147:                            end
 2148:                    end},
 2149:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2150:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2151:                          type     := Type, 
 2152:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2153:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2154:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2155:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2156:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2157:                                    ERROR
 2158:                            end
 2159:                    end},
 2160:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2161:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2162:                          type     := Type, 
 2163:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2164:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2165:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2166:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2167:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2168:                                    ERROR
 2169:                            end
 2170:                    end},
 2171:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2172:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2173:                          type     := Type, 
 2174:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2175:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2176:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2177:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2178:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2179:                                    ERROR
 2180:                            end
 2181:                    end},
 2182:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 2183:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2184:                          type     := Type, 
 2185:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2186:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2187:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2188:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 2189:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2190:                                    ERROR
 2191:                            end
 2192:                    end},
 2193:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2194:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2195: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2196: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2197: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2198: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2199: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2200: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2201:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2202:                            ok
 2203:                    end},
 2204: 
 2205: 
 2206:          %% The actual test
 2207:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2208:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2209:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2210:                                ok ->
 2211:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2212:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2213:                                    ERROR
 2214:                            end
 2215:                    end},
 2216: 
 2217:          %% *** We are done ***
 2218:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2219:         ],
 2220: 
 2221:     TesterSeq =
 2222:         [
 2223:          %% *** Init part ***
 2224:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 2225:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 2226:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 2227:                            ok
