 2314: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2315: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2316: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2317: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2318: 				   {ok, State3}
 2319: 			   after 5000 ->
 2320: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2321: 				   {error, timeout}
 2322: 			   end
 2323:                    end},
 2324:          #{desc => "await socket 2 down",
 2325:            cmd  => fun(#{sock2 := Sock,
 2326: 			 mon2  := MRef} = State) ->
 2327: 			   receive
 2328: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2329: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2330: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2331: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2332: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2333: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2334: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock2, State),
 2335: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon2,  State2),
 2336: 				   {ok, State3}
 2337: 			   after 5000 ->
 2338: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2339: 				   {error, timeout}
 2340: 			   end
 2341:                    end},
 2342:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2343:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2344: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2345: 			   receive
 2346: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2347: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2348: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2349: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2350: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2351: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2352: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2353: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2354: 				   {ok, State3}
 2355: 			   after 5000 ->
 2356: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2357: 				   {error, timeout}
 2358: 			   end
 2359:                    end},
 2360:          #{desc => "await socket 4 down",
 2361:            cmd  => fun(#{sock4 := Sock,
 2362: 			 mon4  := MRef} = State) ->
 2363: 			   receive
 2364: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2365: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2366: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2367: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2368: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2369: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2370: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock4, State),
 2371: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon4,  State2),
 2372: 				   {ok, State3}
 2373: 			   after 5000 ->
 2374: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2375: 				   {error, timeout}
 2376: 			   end
 2377:                    end},
 2378:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
 2379:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
 2380: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2381: 			   receive
 2382: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2383: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2384: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2385: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2386: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2387: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2388: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
 2389: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
 2390: 				   {ok, State3}
 2391: 			   after 5000 ->
 2392: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2393: 				   {error, timeout}
 2394: 			   end
 2395:                    end},
 2396:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2397:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2398: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2399: 			   ok
 2400:                    end},
 2401:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2402:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2403: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2404: 			   ok
 2405:                    end},
 2406: 
 2407:          %% *** We are done ***
 2408:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2409:         ],
 2410: 
 2411:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2412:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2413: 
 2414:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 2415:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 2416:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2417: 
 2418:     i("await evaluator"),
 2419:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 2420: 
 2421: 
 2422: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2423: %% Create several sockets, monitor from a different process, demonitor
 2424: %% two of them then close socket.
 2425: %% The process that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN for
 2426: %% the sockets that are still monitored.
 2427: 
 2428: monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2429:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2430:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks,
 2431:            fun() ->
 2432: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2433:                                  type     => stream,
 2434:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2435:                    ok = mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState)
 2436:            end).
 2437: 
 2438: 
 2439: mon_open_and_demon_and_close_multi_socks(InitState) ->
 2440:     OwnerSeq =
 2441:         [
 2442:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2443:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2444:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2445:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2446:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2447:                    end},
 2448:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2449:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2450:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2451:                            ok
 2452:                    end},
 2453: 
 2454:          %% *** Init part ***
 2455:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 2456:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2457:                          type     := Type, 
 2458:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2459:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2460:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2461:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 2462:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2463:                                    ERROR
 2464:                            end
 2465:                    end},
 2466:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 2467:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2468:                          type     := Type, 
 2469:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2470:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2471:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2472:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 2473:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2474:                                    ERROR
 2475:                            end
 2476:                    end},
 2477:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 2478:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2479:                          type     := Type, 
 2480:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2481:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2482:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2483:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 2484:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2485:                                    ERROR
 2486:                            end
 2487:                    end},
 2488:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 2489:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2490:                          type     := Type, 
 2491:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2492:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2493:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2494:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 2495:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2496:                                    ERROR
 2497:                            end
 2498:                    end},
 2499:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 2500:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2501:                          type     := Type, 
 2502:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2503:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2504:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2505:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 2506:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2507:                                    ERROR
 2508:                            end
 2509:                    end},
 2510:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2511:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 2512: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 2513: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 2514: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 2515: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 2516: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 2517: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 2518:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 2519:                            ok
 2520:                    end},
 2521: 
 2522:          %% The actual test
 2523:          #{desc => "await continue (close1)",
 2524:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2525:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close1)
 2526:                    end},
 2527:          #{desc => "close socket 1",
 2528:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock} = State) ->
 2529:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2530: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock1, State)}
 2531:                    end},
 2532: 
 2533:          #{desc => "await continue (close3)",
 2534:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2535:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close3)
 2536:                    end},
 2537:          #{desc => "close socket 3",
 2538:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock} = State) ->
 2539:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2540: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock3, State)}
 2541:                    end},
 2542: 
 2543:          #{desc => "await continue (close5)",
 2544:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2545:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close5)
 2546:                    end},
 2547:          #{desc => "close socket 5",
 2548:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock} = State) ->
 2549:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2550: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock5, State)}
 2551:                    end},
 2552: 
 2553:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2554:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2555:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2556:                                ok ->
 2557:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2558:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2559:                                    ERROR
 2560:                            end
 2561:                    end},
 2562: 
 2563:          %% *** We are done ***
 2564:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2565:         ],
 2566: 
 2567:     TesterSeq =
 2568:         [
 2569:          %% *** Init part ***
 2570:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 2571:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 2572:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 2573:                            ok
 2574:                    end},
 2575:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 2576:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2577:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 2578:                            ok
 2579:                    end},
 2580:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 2581:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 2582:                            {ok, [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5]} =
 2583: 			       ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 2584:                            {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock1,
 2585: 				       sock2 => Sock2,
 2586: 				       sock3 => Sock3,
 2587: 				       sock4 => Sock4,
 2588: 				       sock5 => Sock5}}
 2589:                    end},
 2590:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2591:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2592: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2593: 			   ok
 2594:                    end},
 2595:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2596:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2597: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2598: 			   ok
 2599:                    end},
 2600:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 2601:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock1,
 2602: 			 sock2 := Sock2,
 2603: 			 sock3 := Sock3,
 2604: 			 sock4 := Sock4,
 2605: 			 sock5 := Sock5} = State) ->
 2606:                            MRef1 = socket:monitor(Sock1),
 2607:                            MRef2 = socket:monitor(Sock2),
 2608:                            MRef3 = socket:monitor(Sock3),
 2609:                            MRef4 = socket:monitor(Sock4),
 2610:                            MRef5 = socket:monitor(Sock5),
 2611: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors:"
 2612: 				       "~n   1: ~p"
 2613: 				       "~n   2: ~p"
 2614: 				       "~n   3: ~p"
 2615: 				       "~n   4: ~p"
 2616: 				       "~n   5: ~p",
 2617: 				       [MRef1, MRef2, MRef3, MRef4, MRef5]),
 2618: 			   {ok, State#{mon1 => MRef1,
 2619: 				       mon2 => MRef2,
 2620: 				       mon3 => MRef3,
 2621: 				       mon4 => MRef4,
 2622: 				       mon5 => MRef5}}
 2623:                    end},
 2624:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=5)",
 2625:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2626: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2627: 			   ok
 2628:                    end},
 2629:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=5)",
 2630:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2631: 			   5 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2632: 			   ok
 2633:                    end},
 2634: 
 2635:          %% The actual test
 2636:          #{desc => "demonitor socket(s)",
 2637:            cmd  => fun(#{mon2 := MRef2,
 2638: 			 mon4 := MRef4} = State) ->
 2639:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef2),
 2640:                            true = socket:cancel_monitor(MRef4),
 2641: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("cancel socket monitor 2 and 4"),
 2642: 			   State2 = maps:remove(mon2,  State),
 2643: 			   State3 = maps:remove(sock2, State2),
 2644: 			   State4 = maps:remove(mon4,  State3),
 2645: 			   State5 = maps:remove(sock4, State4),
 2646: 			   {ok, State5}
 2647:                    end},
 2648:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=3)",
 2649:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2650: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2651: 			   ok
 2652:                    end},
 2653:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=3)",
 2654:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2655: 			   3 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2656: 			   ok
 2657:                    end},
 2658:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 1",
 2659:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2660:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close1),
 2661:                            ok
 2662:                    end},
 2663:          #{desc => "await socket 1 down",
 2664:            cmd  => fun(#{sock1 := Sock,
 2665: 			 mon1  := MRef} = State) ->
 2666: 			   receive
 2667: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2668: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2669: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2670: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2671: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2672: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2673: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock1, State),
 2674: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon1,  State2),
 2675: 				   {ok, State3}
 2676: 			   after 5000 ->
 2677: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2678: 				   {error, timeout}
 2679: 			   end
 2680:                    end},
 2681:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=2)",
 2682:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2683: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2684: 			   ok
 2685:                    end},
 2686:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=2)",
 2687:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2688: 			   2 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2689: 			   ok
 2690:                    end},
 2691: 
 2692:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 3",
 2693:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2694:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close3),
 2695:                            ok
 2696:                    end},
 2697:          #{desc => "await socket 3 down",
 2698:            cmd  => fun(#{sock3 := Sock,
 2699: 			 mon3  := MRef} = State) ->
 2700: 			   receive
 2701: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2702: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2703: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2704: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2705: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2706: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2707: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock3, State),
 2708: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon3,  State2),
 2709: 				   {ok, State3}
 2710: 			   after 5000 ->
 2711: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2712: 				   {error, timeout}
 2713: 			   end
 2714:                    end},
 2715:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=1)",
 2716:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2717: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2718: 			   ok
 2719:                    end},
 2720:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=1)",
 2721:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2722: 			   1 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2723: 			   ok
 2724:                    end},
 2725: 
 2726:          #{desc => "order owner to close socket 5",
 2727:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2728:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close5),
 2729:                            ok
 2730:                    end},
 2731:          #{desc => "await socket 5 down",
 2732:            cmd  => fun(#{sock5 := Sock,
 2733: 			 mon5  := MRef} = State) ->
 2734: 			   receive
 2735: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 2736: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 2737: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 2738: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 2739: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 2740: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 2741: 				   State2 = maps:remove(sock5, State),
 2742: 				   State3 = maps:remove(mon5,  State2),
 2743: 				   {ok, State3}
 2744: 			   after 5000 ->
 2745: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 2746: 				   {error, timeout}
 2747: 			   end
 2748:                    end},
 2749:          #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 2750:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2751: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 2752: 			   ok
 2753:                    end},
 2754:          #{desc => "verify own number of monitors (=0)",
 2755:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 2756: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(self()),
 2757: 			   ok
 2758:                    end},
 2759: 
 2760:          %% Cleanup
 2761:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 2762:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2763:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 2764:                            ok
 2765:                    end},
 2766: 
 2767:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 2768:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 2769:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 2770:                                ok ->
 2771:                                    ok;
 2772:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2773:                                    ERROR
 2774:                            end
 2775:                    end},
 2776: 
 2777:          %% *** We are done ***
 2778:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2779:         ],
 2780: 
 2781:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 2782:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 2783: 
 2784:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 2785:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 2786:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 2787: 
 2788:     i("await evaluator"),
 2789:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 2790: 
 2791: 
 2792: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2793: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 2794: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 2795: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 2796: 
 2797: monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 2798:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 2799:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_close_multi_mon,
 2800:            fun() ->
 2801: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 2802:                                  type     => stream,
 2803:                                  protocol => tcp},
 2804:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState)
 2805:            end).
 2806: 
 2807: 
 2808: mon_open_and_close_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 2809:     OwnerSeq =
 2810:         [
 2811:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 2812:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 2813:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 2814:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 2815:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 2816:                    end},
 2817:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 2818:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 2819:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 2820:                            ok
 2821:                    end},
 2822: 
 2823:          %% *** Init part ***
 2824:          #{desc => "create socket",
 2825:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 2826:                          type     := Type, 
 2827:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 2828:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 2829:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 2830:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 2831:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2832:                                    ERROR
 2833:                            end
 2834:                    end},
 2835:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 2836:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 2837:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 2838:                            ok
 2839:                    end},
 2840: 
 2841:          %% The actual test
 2842:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 2843:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 2844:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 2845:                    end},
 2846: 
 2847:          #{desc => "close socket",
 2848:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 2849:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 2850: 			   {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 2851:                    end},
 2852: 
 2853: 
 2854:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 2855:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 2856:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 2857:                                ok ->
 2858:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 2859:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 2860:                                    ERROR
 2861:                            end
 2862:                    end},
 2863: 
 2864:          %% *** We are done ***
 2865:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 2866:         ],
 2867: 
 2868: 
 2869:     ClientSeq =
 2870:         [

 3381: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3382: %% Create one socket (by 'owner' process), monitor from several different
 3383: %% processes, then close socket (from 'owner').
 3384: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive a socket DOWN.
 3385: 
 3386: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3387:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 3388:     tc_try(monitor_open_and_exit_multi_mon,
 3389:            fun() ->
 3390: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 3391:                                  type     => stream,
 3392:                                  protocol => tcp},
 3393:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState)
 3394:            end).
 3395: 
 3396: 
 3397: mon_open_and_exit_multi_mon(InitState) ->
 3398:     OwnerSeq =
 3399:         [
 3400:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 3401:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 3402:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 3403:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 3404:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 3405:                    end},
 3406:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 3407:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 3408:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 3409:                            ok
 3410:                    end},
 3411: 
 3412:          %% *** Init part ***
 3413:          #{desc => "create socket",
 3414:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 3415:                          type     := Type, 
 3416:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 3417:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 3418:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 3419:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 3420:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3421:                                    ERROR
 3422:                            end
 3423:                    end},
 3424:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 3425:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 3426:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 3427:                            ok
 3428:                    end},
 3429: 
 3430:          %% The actual test
 3431:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 3432:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 3433:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 3434:                                ok ->
 3435:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 3436:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 3437:                                    ERROR
 3438:                            end
 3439:                    end},
 3440: 
 3441:          %% *** We are done ***
 3442:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 3443:         ],
 3444: 
 3445:

 3447:         [

 3452:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}

 3522: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),

 3524: 			   end

 3530:                    end},

 3920: 
 3921:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 3922:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 3923: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 3924: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 3925: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 3926: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 3927: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 3928:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 3929: 
 3930:     i("await evaluator"),
 3931:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 3932: 
 3933: 
 3934: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3935: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 3936: %% different processes, then close each socket (from 'owner').
 3937: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 3938: %% each socket.
 3939: 
 3940: monitor_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3941:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 3942:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 3943:            fun() ->
 3944:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 3945:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 3946:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 3947:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 3948:                        _ ->
 3949:                            ok
 3950:                    end
 3951:            end,
 3952:            fun() ->
 3953: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 3954:                                  type     => stream,
 3955:                                  protocol => tcp},
 3956:                    ok = mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 3957:            end).
 3958: 
 3959: 
 3960: mon_open_and_close_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 3961:     OwnerSeq =
 3962:         [

 4866:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 4867:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 4868: 
 4869:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 4870:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4871: 
 4872:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 4873:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4874:

 4876:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4877: 
 4878:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 4879:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4880: 
 4881:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 4882:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 4883: 
 4884:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 4885:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 4886: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 4887: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 4888: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 4889: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 4890: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 4891:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 4892: 
 4893:     i("await evaluator"),
 4894:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 4895: 
 4896: 
 4897: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4898: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 4899: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 4900: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 4901: %% each socket.
 4902: 
 4903: monitor_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4904:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 4905:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 4906:            fun() ->
 4907:                    FactorKey = kernel_factor,
 4908:                    case lists:keysearch(FactorKey, 1, Config) of
 4909:                        {value, {FactorKey, Factor}} when (Factor > 15) ->
 4910:                            skip("Very slow machine");
 4911:                        _ ->
 4912:                            ok
 4913:                    end
 4914:            end,
 4915:            fun() ->
 4916: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 4917:                                  type     => stream,
 4918:                                  protocol => tcp},
 4919:                    ok = mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState)
 4920:            end).
 4921: 
 4922: 
 4923: mon_open_and_exit_multi_socks_and_mon(InitState) ->
 4924:     OwnerSeq =
 4925:         [
 4926:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 4927:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 4928:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 4929:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 4930:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 4931:                    end},
 4932:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 4933:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 4934:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 4935:                            ok
 4936:                    end},
 4937: 
 4938:          %% *** Init part ***
 4939:          #{desc => "create socket 1",
 4940:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4941:                          type     := Type, 
 4942:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4943:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4944:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4945:                                    {ok, State#{sock1 => Sock}};
 4946:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4947:                                    ERROR
 4948:                            end
 4949:                    end},
 4950:          #{desc => "create socket 2",
 4951:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4952:                          type     := Type, 
 4953:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4954:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4955:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4956:                                    {ok, State#{sock2 => Sock}};
 4957:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4958:                                    ERROR
 4959:                            end
 4960:                    end},
 4961:          #{desc => "create socket 3",
 4962:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4963:                          type     := Type, 
 4964:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4965:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4966:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4967:                                    {ok, State#{sock3 => Sock}};
 4968:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4969:                                    ERROR
 4970:                            end
 4971:                    end},
 4972:          #{desc => "create socket 4",
 4973:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4974:                          type     := Type, 
 4975:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4976:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4977:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4978:                                    {ok, State#{sock4 => Sock}};
 4979:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4980:                                    ERROR
 4981:                            end
 4982:                    end},
 4983:          #{desc => "create socket 5",
 4984:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 4985:                          type     := Type, 
 4986:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 4987:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 4988:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 4989:                                    {ok, State#{sock5 => Sock}};
 4990:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 4991:                                    ERROR
 4992:                            end
 4993:                    end},
 4994:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 4995:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 4996: 			 sock1  := Sock1,
 4997: 			 sock2  := Sock2,
 4998: 			 sock3  := Sock3,
 4999: 			 sock4  := Sock4,
 5000: 			 sock5  := Sock5} = _State) ->
 5001: 			   Socks = [Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5],
 5002:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Socks),
 5003:                            ok
 5004:                    end},
 5005: 
 5006:          %% The actual test
 5007:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5008:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5009:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5010:                                ok ->
 5011:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5012:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5013:                                    ERROR
 5014:                            end
 5015:                    end},
 5016: 
 5017:          %% *** We are done ***
 5018:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5019:         ],
 5020: 
 5021: 
 5022:     ClientSeq =
 5023:         [
 5024:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5025:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5026:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5027:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5028:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5029:                    end},
 5030:          #{desc => "monitor tester",

 5555:                    end},
 5556: 
 5557:          #{desc => "order (client 2) terminate",
 5558:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5559:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5560:                            ok
 5561:                    end},
 5562:          #{desc => "await (client 2) termination",
 5563:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 5564:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5565:                                ok ->
 5566:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client2, State)};
 5567:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5568:                                    ERROR
 5569:                            end
 5570:                    end},
 5571: 
 5572:          #{desc => "order (client 3) terminate",
 5573:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5574:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5575:                            ok
 5576:                    end},
 5577:          #{desc => "await (client 3) termination",
 5578:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 5579:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5580:                                ok ->
 5581:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client3, State)};
 5582:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5583:                                    ERROR
 5584:                            end
 5585:                    end},
 5586: 
 5587:          #{desc => "order (client 4) terminate",
 5588:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5589:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5590:                            ok
 5591:                    end},
 5592:          #{desc => "await (client 4) termination",
 5593:            cmd  => fun(#{client4 := Pid} = State) ->
 5594:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5595:                                ok ->
 5596:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client4, State)};
 5597:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5598:                                    ERROR
 5599:                            end
 5600:                    end},
 5601: 
 5602:          #{desc => "order (client 5) terminate",
 5603:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = _State) ->
 5604:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5605:                            ok
 5606:                    end},
 5607:          #{desc => "await (client 5) termination",
 5608:            cmd  => fun(#{client5 := Pid} = State) ->
 5609:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5610:                                ok ->
 5611:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client5, State)};
 5612:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5613:                                    ERROR
 5614:                            end
 5615:                    end},
 5616: 
 5617:          %% *** We are done ***
 5618:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5619:         ],
 5620: 
 5621:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5622:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5623: 
 5624:     i("start client 1 evaluator"),
 5625:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5626: 
 5627:     i("start client 2 evaluator"),
 5628:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5629: 
 5630:     i("start client 3 evaluator"),
 5631:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5632: 
 5633:     i("start client 4 evaluator"),
 5634:     Client4 = ?SEV_START("client-4", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5635: 
 5636:     i("start client 5 evaluator"),
 5637:     Client5 = ?SEV_START("client-5", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5638: 
 5639:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5640:     TesterInitState = #{owner   => Owner#ev.pid,
 5641: 			client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 5642: 			client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 5643: 			client3 => Client3#ev.pid,
 5644: 			client4 => Client4#ev.pid,
 5645: 			client5 => Client5#ev.pid},
 5646:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5647: 
 5648:     i("await evaluator"),
 5649:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 5650: 
 5651: 
 5652: 
 5653: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5654: %% Create several sockets (by 'owner' process), monitor each from several
 5655: %% different processes, then exit the owner.
 5656: %% The processes that did the monitor shall receive one socket DOWN for
 5657: %% each socket.
 5658: 
 5659: monitor_closed_socket(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5660:     ?TT(?SECS(5)),
 5661:     tc_try(monitor_closed_socket,
 5662:            fun() ->
 5663: 		   InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 5664:                                  type     => stream,
 5665:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5666:                    ok = mon_closed_socket(InitState)
 5667:            end).
 5668: 
 5669: 
 5670: mon_closed_socket(InitState) ->
 5671:     OwnerSeq =
 5672:         [
 5673:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5674:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5675:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5676:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5677:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5678:                    end},
 5679:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5680:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5681:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5682:                            ok
 5683:                    end},
 5684: 
 5685:          %% *** Init part ***
 5686:          #{desc => "create socket",
 5687:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 5688:                          type     := Type, 
 5689:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 5690:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 5691:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 5692:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 5693:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5694:                                    ERROR
 5695:                            end
 5696:                    end},
 5697:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5698:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 5699: 			 sock   := Sock} = State) ->
 5700:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 5701:                            (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 5702:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 5703:                    end},
 5704: 
 5705:          %% The actual test
 5706:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5707:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5708:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5709:                                ok ->
 5710:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5711:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5712:                                    ERROR
 5713:                            end
 5714:                    end},
 5715: 
 5716:          %% *** We are done ***
 5717:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5718:         ],
 5719: 
 5720: 
 5721:     ClientSeq =
 5722:         [
 5723:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 5724:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 5725:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 5726:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 5727:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 5728:                    end},
 5729:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 5730:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5731:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 5732:                            ok
 5733:                    end},
 5734: 
 5735:          %% *** Init part ***
 5736:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 5737:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 5738:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 5739:                            ok
 5740:                    end},
 5741:          #{desc => "await continue (socket)",
 5742:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5743:                            {ok, Sock} =
 5744:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, socket),
 5745: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Socket: "
 5746: 				       "~n      ~p", [Sock]),
 5747: 			   {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5748:                    end},
 5749: 
 5750: 
 5751:          %% The actual test
 5752:          #{desc => "await continue (monitor)",
 5753:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5754:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, monitor)
 5755:                    end},
 5756: 
 5757:          #{desc => "monitor socket",
 5758:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 5759:                            MRef = socket:monitor(Sock),
 5760: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("Monitors: "
 5761: 				       "~n      ~p", [MRef]),
 5762: 			   {ok, State#{mon => MRef}}
 5763:                    end},
 5764:          
 5765:          #{desc => "announce ready (monitor)",
 5766:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5767:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, monitor),
 5768:                            ok
 5769:                    end},
 5770: 
 5771:          #{desc => "await continue (down)",
 5772:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5773:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, down)
 5774:                    end},
 5775: 
 5776:          #{desc => "await socket down",
 5777:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock,
 5778: 			 mon  := MRef} = State) ->
 5779: 			   receive
 5780: 			       {'DOWN', MRef, socket, Sock, Info} ->
 5781: 				   ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected down: "
 5782: 					       "~n      MRef:   ~p"
 5783: 					       "~n      Socket: ~p"
 5784: 					       "~n      Info:   ~p",
 5785: 					       [MRef, Sock, Info]),
 5786: 				   State2 = maps:remove(mon,  State),
 5787: 				   State3 = maps:remove(sock, State2),
 5788: 				   {ok, State3}
 5789: 			   after 1000 ->
 5790: 				   ?SEV_EPRINT("socket down timeout"),
 5791: 				   {error, timeout}
 5792: 			   end
 5793:                    end},
 5794: 
 5795:          #{desc => "announce ready (down)",
 5796:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 5797:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, down),
 5798:                            ok
 5799:                    end},
 5800: 
 5801: 
 5802:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 5803:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 5804:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 5805:                                ok ->
 5806:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 5807:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5808:                                    ERROR
 5809:                            end
 5810:                    end},
 5811: 
 5812:          %% *** We are done ***
 5813:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5814:         ],
 5815: 
 5816:     TesterSeq =
 5817:         [
 5818:          %% *** Init part ***
 5819:          #{desc => "monitor 'owner'",
 5820:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 5821:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 5822:                            ok
 5823:                    end},
 5824:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 5825:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5826:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5827:                            ok
 5828:                    end},
 5829:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 5830:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5831:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 5832:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 5833:                    end},
 5834: 
 5835:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 5836:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5837:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 5838:                            ok
 5839:                    end},
 5840:          #{desc => "order client start",
 5841:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5842:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 5843:                            ok
 5844:                    end},
 5845:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5846:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5847:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 5848:                    end},
 5849:          #{desc => "send socket to client",
 5850:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid,
 5851: 			 sock   := Sock} = _State) ->
 5852:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, socket, Sock),
 5853:                            ok
 5854:                    end},
 5855: 
 5856:          %% The actual test
 5857:          %% There is no way we can actually know that the "system"
 5858:          %% does not create *any* sockets...
 5859:          #{desc => "order client to monitor",
 5860:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5861:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, monitor),
 5862:                            ok
 5863:                    end},
 5864:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5865:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5866:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, monitor)
 5867:                    end},
 5868: 
 5869:          #{desc => "order client to await down",
 5870:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5871:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, down),
 5872:                            ok
 5873:                    end},
 5874: 
 5875: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5876: 
 5877:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 5878:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 5879:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5880:                            ok
 5881:                    end},
 5882:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 5883:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 5884:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5885:                                ok ->
 5886:                                    {ok, maps:remove(owner, State)};
 5887:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5888:                                    ERROR
 5889:                            end
 5890:                    end},
 5891: 
 5892:          #{desc => "await client ready",
 5893:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5894:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, down)
 5895:                    end},
 5896: 
 5897: 	 #{desc => "verify total number of monitors (=0)",
 5898:            cmd  => fun(_State) ->
 5899: 			   0 = socket:number_of_monitors(),
 5900: 			   ok
 5901:                    end},
 5902: 
 5903: 	 ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 5904: 
 5905:          %% Cleanup
 5906:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
 5907:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 5908:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 5909:                            ok
 5910:                    end},
 5911:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 5912:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 5913:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 5914:                                ok ->
 5915:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 5916:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 5917:                                    ERROR
 5918:                            end
 5919:                    end},
 5920: 
 5921:          %% *** We are done ***
 5922:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 5923:         ],
 5924: 
 5925:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 5926:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 5927: 
 5928:     i("start client  evaluator"),
 5929:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, InitState),
 5930: 
 5931:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 5932:     TesterInitState = #{owner  => Owner#ev.pid,
 5933: 			client => Client#ev.pid},
 5934:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 5935: 
 5936:     i("await evaluator"),
 5937:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Client, Tester]).
 5938:
