 5941: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5942: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5943: %%                                                                     %%
 5944: %%                         SOCKET CLOSURE                              %%
 5945: %%                                                                     %%
 5946: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5947: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5948: 
 5949: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5950: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 5951: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 5952: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 TCP (stream) socket.
 5953: 
 5954: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5955:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 5956:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp4,
 5957:            fun() ->
 5958:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 5959:                                  type     => stream,
 5960:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5961:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 5962:            end).
 5963: 
 5964: 
 5965: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5966: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 5967: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 5968: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 TCP (stream) socket.
 5969: 
 5970: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5971:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 5972:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcp6,
 5973:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 5974:            fun() ->
 5975:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 5976:                                  type     => stream,
 5977:                                  protocol => tcp},
 5978:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 5979:            end).
 5980: 
 5981: 
 5982: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 5983: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 5984: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 5985: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (stream) socket (TCP).
 5986: 
 5987: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 5988:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 5989:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_tcpL,
 5990:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 5991:            fun() ->
 5992:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 5993:                                  type     => stream,
 5994:                                  protocol => default},
 5995:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 5996:            end).
 5997: 
 5998: 
 5999: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6000: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6001: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6002: %% calling the close function). For a IPv4 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6003: 
 6004: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6005:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6006:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp4,
 6007:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6008:            fun() ->
 6009:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6010:                                  type     => dgram,
 6011:                                  protocol => udp},
 6012:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6013:            end).
 6014: 
 6015: 
 6016: 
 6017: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6018: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6019: %% (removed) when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6020: %% calling the close function). For a IPv6 UDP (dgram) socket.
 6021: 
 6022: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6023:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6024:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udp6,
 6025:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6026:            fun() ->
 6027:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6028:                                  type     => dgram,
 6029:                                  protocol => udp},
 6030:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6031:            end).
 6032: 
 6033: 
 6034: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6035: %% This test case is intended to test that the sockets are cleaned up
 6036: %% ("removed") when the controlling process terminates (without explicitly 
 6037: %% calling the close function). For a Unix Domain (dgram) socket (UDP).
 6038: 
 6039: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6040:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6041:     tc_try(sc_cpe_socket_cleanup_udpL,
 6042:            fun() ->
 6043: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6044: 		   is_not_windows()
 6045: 	   end,
 6046:            fun() ->
 6047:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6048:                                  type     => dgram,
 6049:                                  protocol => default},
 6050:                    ok = sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState)
 6051:            end).
 6052: 
 6053: 
 6054: 
 6055: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6056: 
 6057: sc_cpe_socket_cleanup(InitState) ->
 6058:     OwnerSeq =
 6059:         [
 6060:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6061:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6062:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6063:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6064:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6065:                    end},
 6066:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6067:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6068:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6069:                            ok
 6070:                    end},
 6071: 
 6072:          %% *** Init part ***
 6073:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6074:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6075:                          type     := Type, 
 6076:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6077:                            case socket:open(Domain, Type, Proto) of
 6078:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6079:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6080:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6081:                                    ERROR
 6082:                            end
 6083:                    end},
 6084:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6085:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6086:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 6087:                            ok
 6088:                    end},
 6089: 
 6090:          %% *** The actual test ***
 6091:          %% We *intentionally* leave the socket "as is", no explicit close
 6092:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6093:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6094:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6095:                                ok ->
 6096:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6097:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6098:                                    ERROR
 6099:                            end
 6100:                    end},
 6101: 
 6102:          %% *** We are done ***
 6103:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6104:         ],
 6105: 
 6106:     TesterSeq =
 6107:         [
 6108:          %% *** Init part ***
 6109:          #{desc => "monitor owner",
 6110:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Owner} = _State) ->
 6111:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Owner),
 6112:                            ok
 6113:                    end},
 6114:          #{desc => "order (owner) start",
 6115:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6116:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6117:                            ok
 6118:                    end},
 6119:          #{desc => "await (owner) ready",
 6120:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = State) ->
 6121:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, owner, init),
 6122:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 6123:                    end},
 6124:          #{desc => "verify owner as controlling-process",
 6125:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6126:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6127:                                {ok, Pid} ->
 6128:                                    ok;
 6129:                                {ok, Other} ->
 6130:                                    {error, {unexpected_owner, Other}};
 6131:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6132:                                    ERROR
 6133:                            end
 6134:                    end},
 6135:          #{desc => "order (owner) terminate",
 6136:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6137:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6138:                            ok
 6139:                    end},
 6140:          #{desc => "await (owner) termination",
 6141:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid} = _State) ->
 6142:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6143:                                ok ->
 6144:                                    ok;
 6145:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6146:                                    ERROR
 6147:                            end
 6148:                    end},
 6149: 
 6150:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
 6151: 
 6152:          %% The reason we get closed, is that as long as there is a ref to 
 6153:          %% the resource (socket), then it will not be garbage collected.
 6154:          %% Note that its still a race that the nif has processed that the
 6155:          %% "controlling process" has terminated. There really is no 
 6156:          %% proper timeout for this, but the 5 seconds "should" be enough...
 6157:          %% We should really have some way to subscribe to socket events...
 6158:          #{desc => "verify no socket (closed)",
 6159:            cmd  => fun(#{owner := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 6160:                            case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, controlling_process) of
 6161:                                {ok, OtherPid} ->
 6162:                                    {error, {unexpected_success, Pid, OtherPid}};
 6163:                                {error, closed} ->
 6164:                                    ok;
 6165:                                {error, Reason} ->
 6166:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("expected failure: ~p", [Reason]),
 6167:                                    {error, {unexpected_failure, Reason}}
 6168:                            end
 6169:                    end},
 6170: 
 6171:          %% *** We are done ***
 6172:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6173:         ],
 6174: 
 6175:     i("start (socket) owner evaluator"),
 6176:     Owner = ?SEV_START("owner", OwnerSeq, InitState),
 6177: 
 6178:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6179:     TesterInitState = #{owner => Owner#ev.pid},
 6180:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6181: 
 6182:     i("await evaluator"),
 6183:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Owner, Tester]).
 6184: 
 6185: 
 6186: 
 6187: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6188: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6189: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recv function.
 6190: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6191: %% 
 6192: %% <KOLLA>
 6193: %% 
 6194: %% We should really have a similar test cases for when the controlling
 6195: %% process exits and there are other processes in recv, accept, and 
 6196: %% all the other functions.
 6197: %% 
 6198: %% </KOLLA>
 6199: 
 6200: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6201:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6202:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp4,
 6203:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6204:            fun() ->
 6205:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6206:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6207:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6208:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6209:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6210:            end).
 6211: 
 6212: 
 6213: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6214: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6215: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6216: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6217: 
 6218: sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6219:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6220:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcp6,
 6221:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6222:            fun() ->
 6223:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6224:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6225:                                  protocol => tcp,
 6226:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6227:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6228:            end).
 6229: 
 6230: 
 6231: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6232: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6233: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6234: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 6235: 
 6236: sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6237:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 6238:     tc_try(sc_lc_recv_response_tcpL,
 6239:            fun() ->
 6240: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket()
 6241: 	   end,
 6242:            fun() ->
 6243:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 6244:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6245:                                  protocol => default,
 6246:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6247:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 6248:            end).
 6249: 
 6250: 
 6251: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6252: 
 6253: sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 6254:     %% This (acceptor) is the server that accepts connections.
 6255:     %% But it is also suppose to close the connection socket, 
 6256:     %% and trigger the read failure (=closed) for the handler process.
 6257:     AcceptorSeq =
 6258:         [
 6259:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6260:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6261:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6262:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6263:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6264:                    end},
 6265:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6266:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6267:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6268:                            ok
 6269:                    end},
 6270: 
 6271:          %% *** Init part ***
 6272:          #{desc => "which local address",
 6273:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6274:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6275:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 6276:                    end},
 6277:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 6278:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6279:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6280:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 6281:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6282:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 6283:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6284:                                    ERROR
 6285:                            end
 6286:                    end},
 6287:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 6288:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6289:                          lsock  := LSock,
 6290:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 6291:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
 6292:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
 6293:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 6294:                                ok ->
 6295:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 6296:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6297:                                    ERROR
 6298:                            end;
 6299:                       (#{lsock := LSock,
 6300:                          lsa   := LSA} = State) ->
 6301:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 6302:                                ok ->
 6303:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 6304:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("bound to port: ~w", [Port]),
 6305:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 6306:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6307:                                    ERROR
 6308:                            end
 6309:                    end},
 6310:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 6311:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 6312:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 6313:                    end},
 6314:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6315:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6316:                          tester := Tester,
 6317:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}}) ->
 6318:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 6319:                            ok;
 6320:                       (#{tester := Tester, lport := Port}) ->
 6321:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Port),
 6322:                            ok
 6323:                    end},
 6324:                            
 6325:          %% The actual test
 6326:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 6327:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6328:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 6329:                                {ok, {H1, H2, H3}} ->
 6330:                                    {ok, State#{handler1 => H1,
 6331:                                                handler2 => H2,
 6332:                                                handler3 => H3}};
 6333:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6334:                                    ERROR
 6335:                            end
 6336:                    end},
 6337:          #{desc => "await accept",
 6338:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 6339:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 6340:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6341:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("connection accepted: "
 6342:                                                "~n   ~p", [socket:sockname(Sock)]),
 6343:                                    {ok, State#{csock => Sock}};
 6344:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6345:                                    ERROR
 6346:                            end
 6347:                    end},
 6348:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept)",
 6349:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6350:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 6351:                            ok
 6352:                    end},
 6353:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 1",
 6354:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6355:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6356:                            ok
 6357:                    end},
 6358:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 2",
 6359:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6360:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6361:                            ok
 6362:                    end},
 6363:          #{desc => "transfer connection to handler 3",
 6364:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Handler, csock := Sock}) ->
 6365:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Handler, transfer, Sock),
 6366:                            ok
 6367:                    end},
 6368:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 6369:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6370:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close),
 6371:                            ok
 6372:                    end},
 6373:          #{desc => "close connection socket",
 6374:            cmd  => fun(#{csock := Sock} = State) ->
 6375:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 6376:                                ok ->
 6377:                                    {ok, maps:remove(csock, State)};
 6378:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6379:                                    ERROR
 6380:                            end
 6381:                    end},
 6382:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 6383:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6384:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 6385:                            ok
 6386:                    end},
 6387: 
 6388:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6389:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 6390:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6391:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6392:                                ok ->
 6393:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6394:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6395:                                    ERROR
 6396:                            end
 6397:                    end},
 6398:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 6399:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6400:                          lsock  := Sock,
 6401:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 6402:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 6403:                            State1 =
 6404:                                unlink_path(Path,
 6405:                                            fun() ->maps:remove(lsa, State) end,
 6406:                                            fun() -> State end),
 6407:                            State2 = maps:remove(lsock, State1),
 6408:                            State3 = maps:remove(lport, State2),
 6409:                            {ok, State3};
 6410:                       (#{lsock := Sock} = State) ->
 6411:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 6412:                                ok ->
 6413:                                    State1 = maps:remove(lsock, State),
 6414:                                    State2 = maps:remove(lport, State1),
 6415:                                    {ok, State2};
 6416:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6417:                                    ERROR
 6418:                            end
 6419:                    end},
 6420: 
 6421:          %% *** We are done ***
 6422:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6423:         ],
 6424: 
 6425:     %% The point of this is to perform the recv for which
 6426:     %% we are testing the response.
 6427:     HandlerSeq =
 6428:         [
 6429:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6430:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6431:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6432:                            {Tester, Acceptor} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6433:                            {ok, State#{tester  => Tester, 
 6434:                                       acceptor => Acceptor}}
 6435:                    end},
 6436:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6437:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6438:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6439:                            ok
 6440:                    end},
 6441:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
 6442:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor} = _State) ->
 6443:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Acceptor),
 6444:                            ok
 6445:                    end},
 6446:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6447:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6448:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6449:                            ok
 6450:                    end},
 6451: 
 6452:          %% The actual test
 6453:          #{desc => "await continue (transfer)",
 6454:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6455:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Pid, acceptor, transfer) of
 6456:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6457:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6458:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6459:                                    ERROR
 6460:                            end
 6461:                    end},
 6462:          #{desc => "announce ready (transfer)",
 6463:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6464:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, transfer),
 6465:                            ok
 6466:                    end},
 6467:          #{desc => "attempt recv (=> closed)",
 6468:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 6469:                            %% ok = socket:setopt(Sock, otp, debug, true),
 6470:                            case Recv(Sock) of
 6471:                                {ok, _Data} ->
 6472:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected data received"),
 6473:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 6474:                                {error, closed} ->
 6475:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received expected 'closed' "
 6476:                                                "result"),
 6477:                                    State1 = maps:remove(sock, State),
 6478:                                    {ok, State1};
 6479:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 6480:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected read failure: "
 6481:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6482:                                    ERROR
 6483:                            end
 6484:                    end},
 6485:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
 6486:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 6487:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 6488:                            ok
 6489:                    end},
 6490: 
 6491:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6492:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 6493:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6494:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6495:                                ok ->
 6496:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6497:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6498:                                    ERROR
 6499:                            end
 6500:                    end},
 6501: 
 6502: 
 6503:          %% *** We are done ***
 6504:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6505:         ],
 6506: 
 6507:     %% The point of this is basically just to create the connection.
 6508:     ClientSeq =
 6509:         [
 6510:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6511:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 6512:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6513:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6514:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6515:                    end},
 6516:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6517:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6518:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6519:                            ok
 6520:                    end},
 6521: 
 6522:          %% *** Init part ***
 6523:          #{desc => "which local address",
 6524:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6525:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6526:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 6527:                    end},
 6528:          #{desc => "create socket",
 6529:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 6530:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6531:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 6532:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 6533:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 6534:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6535:                                    ERROR
 6536:                            end
 6537:                    end},
 6538:          #{desc => "bind socket to local address",
 6539:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA} = _State) ->
 6540:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("bind to LSA: "
 6541:                                        "~n   ~p", [LSA]),
 6542:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6543:                                ok ->
 6544:                                    ok;
 6545:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6546:                                    ERROR
 6547:                            end
 6548:                    end},
 6549:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6550:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6551:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 6552:                            ok
 6553:                    end},
 6554: 
 6555:          %% The actual test
 6556:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 6557:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain,
 6558:                          tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6559:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
 6560:                                {ok, ServerPath} ->
 6561:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Server Path: "
 6562:                                                "~n   ~s", [ServerPath]),
 6563:                                    ServerSA = #{family => Domain,
 6564:                                                 path   => ServerPath},
 6565:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
 6566:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6567:                                    ERROR
 6568:                            end;
 6569:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 6570:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect) of
 6571:                                {ok, Port} ->
 6572:                                    ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 6573:                                    {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}};
 6574:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6575:                                    ERROR
 6576:                            end
 6577:                    end},
 6578:          #{desc => "connect to server",
 6579:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, server_sa := ServerSA}) ->
 6580:                            socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA)
 6581:                    end},
 6582:          #{desc => "announce ready (connect)",
 6583:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6584:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 6585:                            ok
 6586:                    end},
 6587: 
 6588:          %% *** Terminate ***
 6589:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6590:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 6591:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 6592:                                ok ->
 6593:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6594:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6595:                                    ERROR
 6596:                            end                           
 6597:                    end},
 6598:          #{desc => "close socket",
 6599:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 6600:                          sock     := Sock,
 6601:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 6602:                            sock_close(Sock),
 6603:                            State1 =
 6604:                                unlink_path(Path,
 6605:                                            fun() ->
 6606:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 6607:                                            end,
 6608:                                            fun() -> State end),
 6609:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 6610:                        (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 6611:                            sock_close(Sock),
 6612:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)}
 6613:                    end},
 6614: 
 6615:          %% *** We are done ***
 6616:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6617:         ],
 6618: 
 6619:     TesterSeq =
 6620:         [
 6621:          %% *** Init part ***
 6622:          #{desc => "monitor acceptor",
 6623:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6624:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6625:                            ok
 6626:                    end},
 6627:          #{desc => "monitor handler 1",
 6628:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6629:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6630:                            ok
 6631:                    end},
 6632:          #{desc => "monitor handler 2",
 6633:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6634:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6635:                            ok
 6636:                    end},
 6637:          #{desc => "monitor handler 3",
 6638:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6639:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6640:                            ok
 6641:                    end},
 6642:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 6643:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6644:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 6645:                            ok
 6646:                    end},
 6647: 
 6648:          %% Start the acceptor
 6649:          #{desc => "order acceptor start",
 6650:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6651:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6652:                            ok
 6653:                    end},
 6654:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (init)",
 6655:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6656:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, init) of
 6657:                                {ok, PortOrPath} ->
 6658:                                    {ok, State#{server_info => PortOrPath}};
 6659:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6660:                                    ERROR
 6661:                            end
 6662:                    end},
 6663: 
 6664:          %% Start the handler(s)
 6665:          #{desc => "order handler 1 start",
 6666:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6667:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6668:                            ok
 6669:                    end},
 6670:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 6671:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6672:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, init)
 6673:                    end},
 6674:          #{desc => "order handler 2 start",
 6675:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6676:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6677:                            ok
 6678:                    end},
 6679:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 6680:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6681:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, init)
 6682:                    end},
 6683:          #{desc => "order handler 3 start",
 6684:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Acceptor, handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6685:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Acceptor),
 6686:                            ok
 6687:                    end},
 6688:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 6689:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6690:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, init)
 6691:                    end},
 6692: 
 6693:          %% Start the client
 6694:          #{desc => "order client start",
 6695:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6696:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 6697:                            ok
 6698:                    end},
 6699:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 6700:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6701:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, init)
 6702:                    end},
 6703: 
 6704:          %% The actual test
 6705:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (accept)",
 6706:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid, 
 6707:                          handler1 := H1, 
 6708:                          handler2 := H2, 
 6709:                          handler3 := H3} = _State) ->
 6710:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, {H1, H2, H3}),
 6711:                            ok
 6712:                    end},
 6713:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6714:          #{desc => "order client to continue (connect)",
 6715:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid, server_info := Info} = _State) ->
 6716:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect, Info),
 6717:                            ok
 6718:                    end},
 6719:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (accept)",
 6720:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6721:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, accept)
 6722:                    end},
 6723:          #{desc => "await client ready (connect)",
 6724:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6725:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client, connect)
 6726:                    end},
 6727:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (transfer)",
 6728:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6729:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, transfer)
 6730:                    end},
 6731:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (transfer)",
 6732:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6733:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, transfer)
 6734:                    end},
 6735:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (transfer)",
 6736:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6737:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, transfer)
 6738:                    end},
 6739:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 6740:          #{desc => "order acceptor to continue (close connection socket)",
 6741:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6742:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 6743:                            ok
 6744:                    end},
 6745:          #{desc => "await acceptor ready (close)",
 6746:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6747:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, acceptor, close)
 6748:                    end},
 6749:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (recv closed)",
 6750:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6751:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler1, recv_closed)
 6752:                    end},
 6753:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (recv closed)",
 6754:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6755:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler2, recv_closed)
 6756:                    end},
 6757:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (recv closed)",
 6758:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6759:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, handler3, recv_closed)
 6760:                    end},
 6761: 
 6762:          %% Terminations
 6763:          #{desc => "order client to terminate",
 6764:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 6765:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6766:                            ok
 6767:                    end},
 6768:          #{desc => "await client termination",
 6769:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = State) ->
 6770:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6771:                                ok ->
 6772:                                    {ok, maps:remove(client, State)};
 6773:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6774:                                    ERROR
 6775:                            end
 6776:                    end},
 6777:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 6778:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6779:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6780:                            ok
 6781:                    end},
 6782:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 6783:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 6784:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6785:                                ok ->
 6786:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler1, State)};
 6787:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6788:                                    ERROR
 6789:                            end
 6790:                    end},
 6791:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 6792:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6793:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6794:                            ok
 6795:                    end},
 6796:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 6797:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 6798:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6799:                                ok ->
 6800:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler2, State)};
 6801:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6802:                                    ERROR
 6803:                            end
 6804:                    end},
 6805:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 6806:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 6807:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6808:                            ok
 6809:                    end},
 6810:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 6811:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 6812:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6813:                                ok ->
 6814:                                    {ok, maps:remove(handler3, State)};
 6815:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6816:                                    ERROR
 6817:                            end
 6818:                    end},
 6819:          #{desc => "order acceptor to terminate",
 6820:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = _State) ->
 6821:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 6822:                            ok
 6823:                    end},
 6824:          #{desc => "await acceptor termination",
 6825:            cmd  => fun(#{acceptor := Pid} = State) ->
 6826:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 6827:                                ok ->
 6828:                                    {ok, maps:remove(acceptor, State)};
 6829:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6830:                                    ERROR
 6831:                            end
 6832:                    end},
 6833: 
 6834: 
 6835:          %% *** We are done ***
 6836:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 6837:         ],
 6838: 
 6839:     i("start acceptor evaluator"),
 6840:     AccInitState = InitState,
 6841:     Acceptor = ?SEV_START("acceptor", AcceptorSeq, AccInitState),
 6842: 
 6843:     i("start handler 1 evaluator"),
 6844:     HandlerInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
 6845:     Handler1 = ?SEV_START("handler-1", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6846: 
 6847:     i("start handler 2 evaluator"),
 6848:     Handler2 = ?SEV_START("handler-2", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6849: 
 6850:     i("start handler 3 evaluator"),
 6851:     Handler3 = ?SEV_START("handler-3", HandlerSeq, HandlerInitState),
 6852: 
 6853:     i("start client evaluator"),
 6854:     ClientInitState = InitState,
 6855:     Client = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 6856: 
 6857:     i("start tester evaluator"),
 6858:     TesterInitState = #{acceptor => Acceptor#ev.pid,
 6859:                         handler1 => Handler1#ev.pid,
 6860:                         handler2 => Handler2#ev.pid,
 6861:                         handler3 => Handler3#ev.pid,
 6862:                         client   => Client#ev.pid},
 6863:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 6864: 
 6865:     i("await evaluator"),
 6866:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Acceptor, 
 6867:                             Handler1, Handler2, Handler3, 
 6868:                             Client, Tester]).
 6869: 
 6870: 
 6871: 
 6872: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6873: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6874: %% locally closed while a process is calling the recvfrom function.
 6875: %% Socket is IPv4.
 6876: %% 
 6877: 
 6878: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6879:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6880:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6881:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 6882:            fun() ->
 6883:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6884:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6885:                                end,
 6886:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 6887:                                  protocol => udp,
 6888:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6889:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6890:            end).
 6891: 
 6892: 
 6893: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6894: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6895: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6896: %% Socket is IPv6.
 6897: 
 6898: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6899:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6900:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6901:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 6902:            fun() ->
 6903:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6904:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6905:                                end,
 6906:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 6907:                                  protocol => udp,
 6908:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6909:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6910:            end).
 6911: 
 6912: 
 6913: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6914: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 6915: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 6916: %% Socket is Unix Domainm (dgram) socket.
 6917: 
 6918: sc_lc_recvfrom_response_udpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 6919:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 6920:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6921:            fun() ->
 6922: 		   has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6923: 		   is_not_windows()
 6924: 	   end,
 6925:            fun() ->
 6926:                    Recv      = fun(Sock, To) ->
 6927:                                        socket:recvfrom(Sock, [], To)
 6928:                                end,
 6929:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 6930:                                  protocol => default,
 6931:                                  recv     => Recv},
 6932:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState)
 6933:            end).
 6934: 
 6935: 
 6936: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6937: 
 6938: sc_lc_receive_response_udp(InitState) ->
 6939:     PrimServerSeq =
 6940:         [
 6941:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6942:          #{desc => "await start",
 6943:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6944:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6945:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6946:                    end},
 6947:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6948:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6949:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6950:                            ok
 6951:                    end},
 6952: 
 6953:          %% *** Init part ***
 6954:          #{desc => "local address",
 6955:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 6956:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 6957:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 6958:                    end},
 6959:          #{desc => "open socket",
 6960:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 6961:                            Sock = sock_open(Domain, dgram, Proto),
 6962:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 6963:                    end},
 6964:          #{desc => "bind socket",
 6965:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, local_sa := LSA}) ->
 6966:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 6967:                                ok ->
 6968:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("src bound"),
 6969:                                    ok;
 6970:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 6971:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("src bind failed: ~p", [Reason]),
 6972:                                    ERROR
 6973:                            end
 6974:                    end},
 6975:          #{desc => "socket name",
 6976:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 6977:                            case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 6978:                                {ok, SA} ->
 6979:                                    {ok, State#{sa => SA}};
 6980:                                {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 6981:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
 6982:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6983:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 6984:                                    {skip, Reason};
 6985:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 6986:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed get socket name: "
 6987:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6988:                                    ERROR
 6989:                            end
 6990:                    end},
 6991:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6992:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock}) ->
 6993:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 6994:                            ok
 6995:                    end},
 6996: 
 6997:          %% The actual test
 6998:          #{desc => "await continue (recv, with timeout)",
 6999:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7000:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv) of
 7001:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7002:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7003:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7004:                                    ERROR
 7005:                            end
 7006:                    end},
 7007:          #{desc => "receive, with timeout",
 7008:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv, timeout := Timeout}) ->
 7009:                            case Recv(Sock, Timeout) of
 7010:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7011:                                    ok;
 7012:                                {ok, _} ->
 7013:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7014:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7015:                                    ERROR
 7016:                            end
 7017:                    end},
 7018:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv, with timeout)",
 7019:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7020:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv),
 7021:                            ok
 7022:                    end},
 7023:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7024:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7025:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7026:                    end},
 7027:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7028:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 7029:                          sock     := Sock,
 7030:                          local_sa := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7031:                            ok = socket:close(Sock),
 7032:                            State1 =
 7033:                                unlink_path(Path,
 7034:                                            fun() ->
 7035:                                                    maps:remove(local_sa, State)
 7036:                                            end,
 7037:                                            fun() -> State end),
 7038:                            {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7039:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7040:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7041:                                ok ->
 7042:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7043:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7044:                                    ERROR
 7045:                            end
 7046:                    end},
 7047:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7048:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7049:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7050:                            ok
 7051:                    end},
 7052: 
 7053:          %% Termination
 7054:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7055:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7056:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, terminate) of
 7057:                                ok ->
 7058:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7059:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7060:                                    ERROR
 7061:                            end
 7062:                    end},
 7063: 
 7064:          %% *** We are done ***
 7065:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7066:         ],
 7067: 
 7068:     SecServerSeq =
 7069:         [
 7070:          %% *** Init part ***
 7071:          #{desc => "await start",
 7072:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7073:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7074:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7075:                    end},
 7076:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7077:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7078:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7079:                            ok
 7080:                    end},
 7081:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7082:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7083:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 7084:                            ok
 7085:                    end},
 7086: 
 7087:          %% The actual test
 7088:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 7089:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7090:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 7091:                            
 7092:                    end},
 7093:          #{desc => "receive",
 7094:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 7095:                            case Recv(Sock, infinity) of
 7096:                                {error, closed} ->
 7097:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7098:                                {ok, _} ->
 7099:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7100:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7101:                                    ERROR
 7102:                            end
 7103:                    end},
 7104:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed)",
 7105:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7106:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 7107:                            ok
 7108:                    end},
 7109: 
 7110:          %% Termination
 7111:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7112:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7113:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7114:                                ok ->
 7115:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7116:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7117:                                    ERROR
 7118:                            end
 7119:                    end},
 7120: 
 7121:          %% *** We are done ***
 7122:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7123:         ],
 7124: 
 7125: 
 7126:     TesterSeq =
 7127:         [
 7128:          %% *** Init part ***
 7129:          #{desc => "monitor primary server",
 7130:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7131:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7132:                            ok
 7133:                    end},
 7134:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 1",
 7135:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7136:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7137:                            ok
 7138:                    end},
 7139:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 2",
 7140:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7141:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7142:                            ok
 7143:                    end},
 7144:          #{desc => "monitor secondary server 3",
 7145:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7146:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7147:                            ok
 7148:                    end},
 7149: 
 7150:          %% Start the primary server
 7151:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' start",
 7152:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7153:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7154:                            ok
 7155:                    end},
 7156:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (init)",
 7157:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
 7158:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, init),
 7159:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7160:                    end},
 7161: 
 7162:          %% Start the secondary server 1
 7163:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' start",
 7164:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7165:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7166:                            ok
 7167:                    end},
 7168:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (init)",
 7169:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7170:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, init)
 7171:                    end},
 7172: 
 7173:          %% Start the secondary server 2
 7174:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' start",
 7175:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7176:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7177:                            ok
 7178:                    end},
 7179:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (init)",
 7180:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7181:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, init)
 7182:                    end},
 7183: 
 7184:          %% Start the secondary server 3
 7185:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' start",
 7186:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7187:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7188:                            ok
 7189:                    end},
 7190:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (init)",
 7191:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7192:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, init)
 7193:                    end},
 7194: 
 7195: 
 7196:          %% The actual test
 7197:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7198:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7199:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7200:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7201:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7202: 
 7203:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to continue (recv)",
 7204:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7205:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7206:                            ok
 7207:                    end},
 7208:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7209:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to continue (recv)",
 7210:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7211:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7212:                            ok
 7213:                    end},
 7214:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7215:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to continue (recv)",
 7216:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7217:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 7218:                            ok
 7219:                    end},
 7220:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7221:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (recv, with timeout)",
 7222:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7223:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv, ?SECS(5)),
 7224:                            ok
 7225:                    end},
 7226:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (recv, with timeout)",
 7227:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7228:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, recv)
 7229:                    end},
 7230:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to continue (close)",
 7231:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7232:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7233:                            ok
 7234:                    end},
 7235:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' ready (close)",
 7236:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7237:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_server, close)
 7238:                    end},
 7239:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' ready (closed)",
 7240:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7241:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server1, recv_closed)
 7242:                    end},
 7243:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' ready (closed)",
 7244:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7245:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server2, recv_closed)
 7246:                    end},
 7247:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' ready (closed)",
 7248:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7249:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_server3, recv_closed)
 7250:                    end},
 7251: 
 7252:          %% Terminations
 7253:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 3' to terminate",
 7254:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7255:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7256:                            ok
 7257:                    end},
 7258:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 3' termination",
 7259:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7260:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7261:                                ok ->
 7262:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server3, State)};
 7263:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7264:                                    ERROR
 7265:                            end
 7266:                    end},
 7267:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 2' to terminate",
 7268:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7269:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7270:                            ok
 7271:                    end},
 7272:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 2' termination",
 7273:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7274:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7275:                                ok ->
 7276:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server2, State)};
 7277:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7278:                                    ERROR
 7279:                            end
 7280:                    end},
 7281:          #{desc => "order 'secondary server 1' to terminate",
 7282:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7283:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7284:                            ok
 7285:                    end},
 7286:          #{desc => "await 'secondary server 1' termination",
 7287:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_server1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7288:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7289:                                ok ->
 7290:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_server1, State)};
 7291:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7292:                                    ERROR
 7293:                            end
 7294:                    end},
 7295:          #{desc => "order 'primary server' to terminate",
 7296:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7297:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7298:                            ok
 7299:                    end},
 7300:          #{desc => "await 'primary server' termination",
 7301:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_server := Pid} = State) ->
 7302:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7303:                                ok ->
 7304:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_server, State)};
 7305:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7306:                                    ERROR
 7307:                            end
 7308:                    end},
 7309: 
 7310: 
 7311:          %% *** We are done ***
 7312:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7313:         ],
 7314:     
 7315: 
 7316:     i("start 'primary server' evaluator"),
 7317:     PrimSrvInitState = InitState,
 7318:     PrimServer = ?SEV_START("prim-server", PrimServerSeq, PrimSrvInitState),
 7319: 
 7320:     i("start 'secondary server 1' evaluator"),
 7321:     SecSrvInitState = #{recv => maps:get(recv, InitState)},
 7322:     SecServer1 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-1", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7323: 
 7324:     i("start 'secondary server 2' evaluator"),
 7325:     SecServer2 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-2", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7326: 
 7327:     i("start 'secondary server 3' evaluator"),
 7328:     SecServer3 = ?SEV_START("sec-server-3", SecServerSeq, SecSrvInitState),
 7329: 
 7330:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7331:     TesterInitState = #{prim_server => PrimServer#ev.pid,
 7332:                         sec_server1 => SecServer1#ev.pid,
 7333:                         sec_server2 => SecServer2#ev.pid,
 7334:                         sec_server3 => SecServer3#ev.pid},
 7335:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7336: 
 7337:     i("await evaluator"),
 7338:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimServer, 
 7339:                             SecServer1, SecServer2, SecServer3,
 7340:                             Tester]).
 7341:

 7346: %% locally closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.

 7350:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),

 7352:            fun() ->
 7353:                    is_not_windows(), % recvmsg does not work on Windows
 7354:                    has_support_ipv4()
 7355:            end,
 7356:            fun() ->
 7357:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 7358:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7359:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7360:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7361:                    ok = sc_lc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7362:            end).

 7486: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.

 7488: %% git the setup anyway.
