 7501: 
 7502: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7503: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7504: %% locally closed while the process is calling the accept function.
 7505: %% We test what happens with a non-controlling_process also, since we 
 7506: %% git the setup anyway.
 7507: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 7508: 
 7509: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7510:     ?TT(?SECS(10)),
 7511:     tc_try(sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcpL,
 7512:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 7513:            fun() ->
 7514:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7515:                                  protocol => default},
 7516:                    ok = sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState)
 7517:            end).
 7518: 
 7519: 
 7520: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7521: 
 7522: sc_lc_acceptor_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 7523:     PrimAcceptorSeq =
 7524:         [
 7525:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7526:          #{desc => "await start (from tester)",
 7527:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7528:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7529:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 7530:                    end},
 7531:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7532:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7533:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7534:                            ok
 7535:                    end},
 7536: 
 7537:          %% *** Init part ***
 7538:          #{desc => "which local address",
 7539:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 7540:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 7541:                            {ok, State#{lsa => LSA}}
 7542:                    end},
 7543:          #{desc => "create (listen) socket",
 7544:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := Domain, 
 7545:                          protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 7546:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 7547:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7548:                                    {ok, State#{sock => Sock}};
 7549:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7550:                                    ERROR
 7551:                            end
 7552:                    end},
 7553:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 7554:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock, lsa := LSA} = _State) ->
 7555:                            case sock_bind(Sock, LSA) of
 7556:                                ok ->
 7557:                                    ok;
 7558:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7559:                                    ERROR
 7560:                            end
 7561:                    end},
 7562:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 7563:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 7564:                            socket:listen(Sock)
 7565:                    end},
 7566:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7567:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7568:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Sock),
 7569:                            ok
 7570:                    end},
 7571: 
 7572:          %% The actual test
 7573:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7574:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7575:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept) of
 7576:                                {ok, Timeout} ->
 7577:                                    {ok, State#{timeout => Timeout}};
 7578:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7579:                                    ERROR
 7580:                            end
 7581:                    end},
 7582:          #{desc => "await connection",
 7583:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := LSock, timeout := Timeout} = _State) ->
 7584:                            case socket:accept(LSock, Timeout) of
 7585:                                {error, timeout} ->
 7586:                                    ok;
 7587:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 7588:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("unexpected success"),
 7589:                                    (catch socket:close(Sock)),
 7590:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7591:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7592:                                    ERROR
 7593:                            end
 7594:                    end},
 7595:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept timeout)",
 7596:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7597:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_timeout),
 7598:                            ok
 7599:                    end},
 7600:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 7601:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7602:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close)
 7603:                    end},
 7604:          #{desc => "close socket",
 7605:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 7606:                          sock   := Sock,
 7607:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 7608:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7609:                                ok ->
 7610:                                    State1 =
 7611:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 7612:                                                    fun() ->
 7613:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 7614:                                                    end,
 7615:                                                    fun() ->
 7616:                                                            State
 7617:                                                    end),
 7618:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State1)};
 7619:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7620:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 7621:                                    ERROR
 7622:                            end;
 7623:                       (#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7624:                            case socket:close(Sock) of
 7625:                                ok ->
 7626:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7627:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7628:                                    ERROR
 7629:                            end
 7630:                    end},
 7631:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 7632:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7633:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 7634:                            ok
 7635:                    end},
 7636: 
 7637:                                                 % Termination
 7638:          #{desc => "await terminate",
 7639:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7640:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7641:                                ok ->
 7642:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7643:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7644:                                    ERROR
 7645:                            end
 7646:                    end},
 7647: 
 7648:          %% *** We are done ***
 7649:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7650:         ],
 7651: 
 7652:     SecAcceptorSeq =
 7653:         [
 7654:          %% *** Init part ***
 7655:          #{desc => "await start",
 7656:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7657:                            {Tester, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7658:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester, sock => Sock}}
 7659:                    end},
 7660:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7661:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7662:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7663:                            ok
 7664:                    end},
 7665:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7666:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7667:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init)
 7668:                    end},
 7669: 
 7670:          %% The actual test
 7671:          #{desc => "await continue (accept)",
 7672:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7673:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 7674:                    end},
 7675:          #{desc => "accept",
 7676:            cmd  => fun(#{sock := Sock} = State) ->
 7677:                            case socket:accept(Sock) of
 7678:                                {error, closed} ->
 7679:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sock, State)};
 7680:                                {ok, _} ->
 7681:                                    {error, unexpected_success};
 7682:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7683:                                    ERROR
 7684:                            end
 7685:                    end},
 7686:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept closed)",
 7687:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7688:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept_closed)
 7689:                    end},
 7690: 
 7691:          %% Termination
 7692:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7693:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7694:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7695:                                ok ->
 7696:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7697:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7698:                                    ERROR
 7699:                            end
 7700:                    end},
 7701: 
 7702:          %% *** We are done ***
 7703:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7704:         ],
 7705: 
 7706:     TesterSeq =
 7707:         [
 7708:          %% *** Init part ***
 7709:          #{desc => "monitor 'primary acceptor'",
 7710:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7711:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7712:                            ok
 7713:                    end},
 7714:          #{desc => "monitor 'secondary acceptor 1'",
 7715:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7716:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7717:                            ok
 7718:                    end},
 7719:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 2",
 7720:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7721:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7722:                            ok
 7723:                    end},
 7724:          #{desc => "monitor secondary acceptor 3",
 7725:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7726:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7727:                            ok
 7728:                    end},
 7729: 
 7730:          %% Start the primary server
 7731:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' start",
 7732:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7733:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7734:                            ok
 7735:                    end},
 7736:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (init)",
 7737:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7738:                            {ok, Sock} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, init),
 7739:                            {ok, State#{sock => Sock}}
 7740:                    end},
 7741: 
 7742:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 1
 7743:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' start",
 7744:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7745:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7746:                            ok
 7747:                    end},
 7748:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (init)",
 7749:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7750:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, init)
 7751:                    end},
 7752: 
 7753:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 2
 7754:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' start",
 7755:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7756:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7757:                            ok
 7758:                    end},
 7759:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (init)",
 7760:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7761:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, init)
 7762:                    end},
 7763: 
 7764:          %% Start the secondary acceptor 3
 7765:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' start",
 7766:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid, sock := Sock} = _State) ->
 7767:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Sock),
 7768:                            ok
 7769:                    end},
 7770:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (init)",
 7771:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7772:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, init)
 7773:                    end},
 7774: 
 7775: 
 7776:          %% The actual test
 7777:          %% Make all the seondary servers continue, with an infinite recvfrom
 7778:          %% and then the prim-server with a timed recvfrom.
 7779:          %% After the prim server notifies us (about the timeout) we order it
 7780:          %% to close the socket, which should cause the all the secondary 
 7781:          %% server to return with error-closed.
 7782: 
 7783:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to continue (accept)",
 7784:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7785:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7786:                            ok
 7787:                    end},
 7788:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7789:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to continue (accept)",
 7790:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7791:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7792:                            ok
 7793:                    end},
 7794:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7795:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to continue (accept)",
 7796:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7797:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 7798:                            ok
 7799:                    end},
 7800:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7801:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue",
 7802:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7803:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept, ?SECS(5)),
 7804:                            ok
 7805:                    end},
 7806:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (accept timeout)",
 7807:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7808:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, accept_timeout)
 7809:                    end},
 7810:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to continue (close)",
 7811:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7812:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 7813:                            ok
 7814:                    end},
 7815:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' ready (close)",
 7816:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7817:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, prim_acc, close)
 7818:                    end},
 7819:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' ready (accept closed)",
 7820:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7821:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc1, accept_closed)
 7822:                    end},
 7823:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' ready (accept closed)",
 7824:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7825:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc2, accept_closed)
 7826:                    end},
 7827:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' ready (accept closed)",
 7828:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7829:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, sec_acc3, accept_closed)
 7830:                    end},
 7831: 
 7832: 
 7833:          %% Terminations
 7834:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 3' to terminate",
 7835:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7836:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7837:                            ok
 7838:                    end},
 7839:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 3' termination",
 7840:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc3 := Pid} = State) ->
 7841:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7842:                                ok ->
 7843:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc3, State)};
 7844:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7845:                                    ERROR
 7846:                            end
 7847:                    end},
 7848:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 2' to terminate",
 7849:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7850:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7851:                            ok
 7852:                    end},
 7853:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 2' termination",
 7854:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc2 := Pid} = State) ->
 7855:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7856:                                ok ->
 7857:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc2, State)};
 7858:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7859:                                    ERROR
 7860:                            end
 7861:                    end},
 7862:          #{desc => "order 'secondary acceptor 1' to terminate",
 7863:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 7864:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7865:                            ok
 7866:                    end},
 7867:          #{desc => "await 'secondary acceptor 1' termination",
 7868:            cmd  => fun(#{sec_acc1 := Pid} = State) ->
 7869:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7870:                                ok ->
 7871:                                    {ok, maps:remove(sec_acc1, State)};
 7872:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7873:                                    ERROR
 7874:                            end
 7875:                    end},
 7876:          #{desc => "order 'primary acceptor' to terminate",
 7877:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = _State) ->
 7878:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 7879:                            ok
 7880:                    end},
 7881:          #{desc => "await 'primary acceptor' termination",
 7882:            cmd  => fun(#{prim_acc := Pid} = State) ->
 7883:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 7884:                                ok ->
 7885:                                    {ok, maps:remove(prim_acc, State)};
 7886:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7887:                                    ERROR
 7888:                            end
 7889:                    end},
 7890: 
 7891: 
 7892:          %% *** We are done ***
 7893:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7894:         ],
 7895: 
 7896: 
 7897:     i("start 'primary acceptor' evaluator"),
 7898:     PrimAccInitState = InitState,
 7899:     PrimAcc = ?SEV_START("prim-acceptor", PrimAcceptorSeq, PrimAccInitState),
 7900: 
 7901:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 1' evaluator"),
 7902:     SecAccInitState = #{},
 7903:     SecAcc1 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-1", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7904: 
 7905:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 2' evaluator"),
 7906:     SecAcc2 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-2", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7907: 
 7908:     i("start 'secondary acceptor 3' evaluator"),
 7909:     SecAcc3 = ?SEV_START("sec-acceptor-3", SecAcceptorSeq, SecAccInitState),
 7910: 
 7911:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7912:     TesterInitState = #{prim_acc => PrimAcc#ev.pid,
 7913:                         sec_acc1 => SecAcc1#ev.pid,
 7914:                         sec_acc2 => SecAcc2#ev.pid,
 7915:                         sec_acc3 => SecAcc3#ev.pid},
 7916:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7917: 
 7918:     i("await evaluator"),
 7919:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([PrimAcc, SecAcc1, SecAcc2, SecAcc3, Tester]).
 7920: 
 7921: 
 7922: 
 7923: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7924: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7925: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7926: %% Socket is IPv4.
 7927: %%
 7928: %% To minimize the chance of "weirdness", we should really have test cases
 7929: %% where the two sides of the connection is on different machines. But for
 7930: %% now, we will make do with different VMs on the same host.
 7931: %%
 7932: 
 7933: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7934:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7935:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7936:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 7937:            fun() ->
 7938:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7939:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 7940:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7941:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7942:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7943:            end).
 7944: 
 7945: 
 7946: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7947: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7948: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7949: %% Socket is IPv6.
 7950: 
 7951: sc_rc_recv_response_tcp6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7952:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7953:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7954:            fun() -> has_support_ipv6() end,
 7955:            fun() ->
 7956:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7957:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet6,
 7958:                                  protocol => tcp,
 7959:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7960:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7961:            end).
 7962: 
 7963: 
 7964: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7965: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 7966: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recv function.
 7967: %% Socket is Unix Domain (stream) socket.
 7968: 
 7969: sc_rc_recv_response_tcpL(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 7970:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 7971:     tc_try(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7972:            fun() -> has_support_unix_domain_socket() end,
 7973:            fun() ->
 7974:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recv(Sock) end,
 7975:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 7976:                                  protocol => default,
 7977:                                  recv     => Recv},
 7978:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 7979:            end).
 7980: 
 7981: 
 7982: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7983: 
 7984: sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState) ->
 7985:     %% Each connection are handled by handler processes.
 7986:     %% These are created (on the fly) and handled internally 
 7987:     %% by the server!
 7988:     ServerSeq =
 7989:         [
 7990:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7991:          #{desc => "await start",
 7992:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 7993:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7994:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 7995:                    end},
 7996:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7997:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7998:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7999:                            ok
 8000:                    end},
 8001: 
 8002:          %% *** Init part ***
 8003:          #{desc => "which local address",
 8004:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain} = State) ->
 8005:                            LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8006:                            {ok, State#{local_sa => LSA}}
 8007:                    end},
 8008:          #{desc => "create listen socket",
 8009:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := Domain, protocol := Proto} = State) ->
 8010:                            case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8011:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8012:                                    {ok, State#{lsock => Sock}};
 8013:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8014:                                    ERROR
 8015:                            end
 8016:                    end},
 8017:          #{desc => "bind to local address",
 8018:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8019:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8020:                          lsa    := LSA} = _State) ->
 8021:                            case socket:bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8022:                                ok ->
 8023:                                    ok; % We do not care about the port for local
 8024:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8025:                                    ERROR
 8026:                            end;
 8027:                       (#{lsock    := LSock,
 8028:                          local_sa := LSA} = State) ->
 8029:                            case sock_bind(LSock, LSA) of
 8030:                                ok ->
 8031:                                    Port = sock_port(LSock),
 8032:                                    {ok, State#{lport => Port}};
 8033:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8034:                                    ERROR
 8035:                            end
 8036:                    end},
 8037:          #{desc => "make listen socket",
 8038:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8039:                            socket:listen(LSock)
 8040:                    end},
 8041:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8042:            cmd  => fun(#{domain   := local,
 8043:                          tester   := Tester,
 8044:                          local_sa := LSA}) ->
 8045:                            %% Actually we only need to send the path,
 8046:                            %% but to keep it simple, we send the "same"
 8047:                            %% as for non-local.
 8048:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, LSA),
 8049:                            ok;
 8050:                       (#{tester := Tester, local_sa := LSA, lport := Port}) ->
 8051:                            ServerSA = LSA#{port => Port},
 8052:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, ServerSA),
 8053:                            ok
 8054:                    end},
 8055: 
 8056:          %% The actual test
 8057:          #{desc => "await continue (accept all three connections)",
 8058:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8059:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, accept)
 8060:                    end},
 8061:          #{desc => "accept 1",
 8062:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8063:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8064:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8065:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8066:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(1, Recv, Sock),
 8067:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8068:                                    {ok, State#{csock1   => Sock,
 8069:                                                handler1 => Handler}};
 8070:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8071:                                    ERROR
 8072:                            end
 8073:                    end},
 8074:          #{desc => "await handler 1 ready (init)",
 8075:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8076:                          handler1 := Handler1} = _State) ->
 8077:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler1, handler1, init, 
 8078:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8079:                    end},
 8080:          #{desc => "accept 2",
 8081:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8082:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8083:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8084:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8085:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(2, Recv, Sock),
 8086:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8087:                                    {ok, State#{csock2   => Sock,
 8088:                                                handler2 => Handler}};
 8089:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8090:                                    ERROR
 8091:                            end
 8092:                    end},
 8093:          #{desc => "await handler 2 ready (init)",
 8094:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8095:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8096:                          handler2 := Handler2} = _State) ->
 8097:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler2, handler2, init, 
 8098:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8099:                                              {handler1, Handler1}])
 8100:                    end},
 8101:          #{desc => "accept 3",
 8102:            cmd  => fun(#{lsock := LSock, recv := Recv} = State) ->
 8103:                            case socket:accept(LSock) of
 8104:                                {ok, Sock} ->
 8105:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("accepted: try start handler"),
 8106:                                    Handler = sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(3, Recv, Sock),
 8107:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("handler started"),
 8108:                                    {ok, State#{csock3   => Sock,
 8109:                                                handler3 => Handler}};
 8110:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8111:                                    ERROR
 8112:                            end
 8113:                    end},
 8114:          #{desc => "await handler 3 ready (init)",
 8115:            cmd  => fun(#{tester   := Tester, 
 8116:                          handler1 := Handler1, 
 8117:                          handler2 := Handler2, 
 8118:                          handler3 := Handler3} = _State) ->
 8119:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Handler3, handler3, init, 
 8120:                                             [{tester,   Tester},
 8121:                                              {handler1, Handler1},
 8122:                                              {handler2, Handler2}])
 8123:                    end},
 8124:          #{desc => "announce ready (accept all three connections)",
 8125:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8126:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, accept),
 8127:                            ok
 8128:                    end},
 8129: 
 8130: 
 8131:          #{desc => "await continue (recv)",
 8132:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8133:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, recv)
 8134:                    end},
 8135:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to receive",
 8136:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8137:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8138:                            ok
 8139:                    end},
 8140:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to receive",
 8141:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8142:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8143:                            ok
 8144:                    end},
 8145:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to receive",
 8146:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8147:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8148:                            ok
 8149:                    end},
 8150:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 1 (recv)",
 8151:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8152:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8153:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8154:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8155:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid1, handler1, recv, 
 8156:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8157:                                                   {handler2, Pid2},
 8158:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8159:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8160:                                    Result;
 8161:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8162:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected failure: "
 8163:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8164:                                    ERROR
 8165:                            end
 8166:                    end},
 8167:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 2 (recv)",
 8168:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8169:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8170:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8171:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8172:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid2, handler2, recv, 
 8173:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8174:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8175:                                                   {handler3, Pid3}]) of
 8176:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8177:                                    Result;
 8178:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8179:                                    ERROR
 8180:                            end
 8181:                    end},
 8182:          #{desc => "await ready from handler 3 (recv)",
 8183:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 8184:                          handler1 := Pid1,
 8185:                          handler2 := Pid2,
 8186:                          handler3 := Pid3} = _State) ->
 8187:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid3, handler3, recv, 
 8188:                                                  [{tester, Tester},
 8189:                                                   {handler1, Pid1},
 8190:                                                   {handler2, Pid2}]) of
 8191:                                {ok, Result} ->
 8192:                                    Result;
 8193:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8194:                                    ERROR
 8195:                            end
 8196:                    end},
 8197:          #{desc => "announce ready (recv closed from all handlers)",
 8198:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8199:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, recv_closed),
 8200:                            ok
 8201:                    end},
 8202: 
 8203:          %% Termination
 8204:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8205:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 8206:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 8207:                                ok ->
 8208:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8209:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8210:                                    ERROR
 8211:                            end
 8212:                    end},
 8213:          #{desc => "order handler 1 to terminate",
 8214:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8215:                            %% Pid ! {terminate, self(), ok},
 8216:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8217:                            ok
 8218:                    end},
 8219:          #{desc => "await handler 1 termination",
 8220:            cmd  => fun(#{handler1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8221:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8222:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock1,   State),
 8223:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler1, State1),
 8224:                            {ok, State2}
 8225:                    end},
 8226:          #{desc => "order handler 2 to terminate",
 8227:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8228:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8229:                            ok
 8230:                    end},
 8231:          #{desc => "await handler 2 termination",
 8232:            cmd  => fun(#{handler2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8233:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8234:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock2,   State),
 8235:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler2, State1),
 8236:                            {ok, State2}
 8237:                    end},
 8238:          #{desc => "order handler 3 to terminate",
 8239:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8240:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8241:                            ok
 8242:                    end},
 8243:          #{desc => "await handler 3 termination",
 8244:            cmd  => fun(#{handler3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8245:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid),
 8246:                            State1 = maps:remove(csock3,   State),
 8247:                            State2 = maps:remove(handler3, State1),
 8248:                            {ok, State2}
 8249:                    end},
 8250:          #{desc => "close listen socket",
 8251:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 8252:                          lsock  := LSock,
 8253:                          lsa    := #{path := Path}} = State) ->
 8254:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8255:                                ok ->
 8256:                                    State1 =
 8257:                                        unlink_path(Path,
 8258:                                                    fun() ->
 8259:                                                            maps:remove(lsa, State)
 8260:                                                    end,
 8261:                                                    fun() ->
 8262:                                                            State
 8263:                                                    end),
 8264:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State1)};
 8265:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8266:                                    unlink_path(Path),
 8267:                                    ERROR
 8268:                            end;
 8269:                       (#{lsock := LSock} = State) ->
 8270:                            case socket:close(LSock) of
 8271:                                ok ->
 8272:                                    {ok, maps:remove(lsock, State)};
 8273:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8274:                                    ERROR
 8275:                            end
 8276:                    end},
 8277: 
 8278:          %% *** We are done ***
 8279:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8280:         ],
 8281: 
 8282:     ClientSeq =
 8283:         [
 8284:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 8285:          #{desc => "await start",
 8286:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 8287:                            {Tester, {NodeID, ServerSA}} = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 8288:                            {ok, State#{tester    => Tester, 
 8289:                                        node_id   => NodeID, 
 8290:                                        server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8291:                    end},
 8292:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 8293:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 8294:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 8295:                            ok
 8296:                    end},
 8297: 
 8298:          %% *** Init part ***
 8299:          #{desc => "create node",
 8300:            cmd  => fun(#{node_id := NodeID} = State) ->
 8301:                            {Peer, Node} =
 8302:                                start_node(?CT_PEER_NAME(?F("client_~w",
 8303:                                                            [NodeID]))),
 8304:                            {ok, State#{node => Node, peer => Peer}}
 8305:                    end},
 8306:          #{desc => "monitor client node 1",
 8307:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) ->
 8308:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 8309:                            ok
 8310:                    end},
 8311:          #{desc => "start remote client on client node",
 8312:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = State) ->
 8313:                            Pid = sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node),
 8314:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("client ~p started", [Pid]),
 8315:                            {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}}
 8316:                    end},
 8317:          #{desc => "monitor remote client",
 8318:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Pid}) ->
 8319:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8320:                            ok
 8321:                    end},
 8322:          #{desc => "order remote client to start",
 8323:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient   := Client,
 8324:                          server_sa := ServerSA,
 8325:                          protocol  := Proto}) ->
 8326:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Client, {ServerSA, Proto}),
 8327:                            ok
 8328:                    end},
 8329:          #{desc => "await remote client ready",
 8330:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8331:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8332:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, init, 
 8333:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8334:                    end},
 8335:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 8336:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8337:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 8338:                            ok
 8339:                    end},
 8340: 
 8341:          %% The actual test
 8342:          #{desc => "await continue (connect)",
 8343:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8344:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8345:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, connect, 
 8346:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8347:                            ok
 8348:                    end},
 8349:          #{desc => "order remote client to continue (connect)",
 8350:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8351:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, connect),
 8352:                            ok
 8353:                    end},
 8354:          #{desc => "await client process ready (connect)",
 8355:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8356:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8357:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, connect, 
 8358:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8359:                    end},
 8360:          #{desc => "announce ready (connected)",
 8361:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8362:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, connect),
 8363:                            ok
 8364:                    end},
 8365:          #{desc => "await continue (close)",
 8366:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8367:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8368:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, close, 
 8369:                                                [{rclient, Client}]),
 8370:                            ok
 8371:                    end},
 8372:          #{desc => "order remote client to close",
 8373:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := Client}) ->
 8374:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, close),
 8375:                            ok
 8376:                    end},
 8377:          #{desc => "await remote client ready (closed)",
 8378:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 8379:                          rclient := Client} = _State) ->
 8380:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, rclient, close, 
 8381:                                             [{tester, Tester}])
 8382:                    end},
 8383:          #{desc => "announce ready (close)",
 8384:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 8385:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, close),
 8386:                            ok
 8387:                    end},
 8388: 
 8389:          %% Termination
 8390:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 8391:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 8392:                          rclient := Client} = State) ->
 8393:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 8394:                                                      [{rclient, Client}]) of
 8395:                                ok ->
 8396:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 8397:                                {error,
 8398:                                 {unexpected_exit, rclient, noconnection}} ->
 8399:                                    %% Global might have disconnected => SKIP
 8400:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("lost connection "
 8401:                                                "to remote client node => SKIP"),
 8402:                                    {skip, {rclient, noconnection}};
 8403:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8404:                                    ERROR
 8405:                            end
 8406:                    end},
 8407:          #{desc => "kill remote client",
 8408:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient}) ->
 8409:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("try kill remote client ~p", [RClient]),
 8410:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(RClient),
 8411:                            ok
 8412:                    end},
 8413:          #{desc => "await remote client termination",
 8414:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 8415:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
 8416:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("remote client ~p terminated",
 8417:                                        [RClient]),
 8418:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 8419:                            {ok, State1}
 8420:                    end},
 8421:          #{desc => "stop client node",
 8422:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) ->
 8423:                            {ok,
 8424:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 8425:                                 ok ->
 8426:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 8427:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 8428:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8429:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8430:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8431:                             catch
 8432:                                 C:E:S ->
 8433:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 8434:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 8435:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 8436:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 8437:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 8438:                             end}
 8439:                    end},
 8440:          #{desc => "await client node termination",
 8441:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State) ->
 8442:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown: "
 8443:                                        "~n      ~p", [Node]),
 8444:                            receive
 8445:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 8446:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 8447:                                    State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8448:                                    State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8449:                                    {ok, State2}
 8450:                            end;
 8451:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 8452:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 8453:                            State1 = maps:remove(peer, State),
 8454:                            State2 = maps:remove(node, State1),
 8455:                            {ok, State2}
 8456:                    end},
 8457: 
 8458:          %% *** We are done ***
 8459:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8460:         ],
 8461: 
 8462:     TesterSeq =
 8463:         [
 8464:          %% *** Init part ***
 8465:          #{desc => "monitor server",
 8466:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8467:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8468:                            ok
 8469:                    end},
 8470:          #{desc => "monitor client 1",
 8471:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8472:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8473:                            ok
 8474:                    end},
 8475:          #{desc => "monitor client 2",
 8476:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8477:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8478:                            ok
 8479:                    end},
 8480:          #{desc => "monitor client 3",
 8481:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8482:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 8483:                            ok
 8484:                    end},
 8485: 
 8486:          %% Start the server
 8487:          #{desc => "order server start",
 8488:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8489:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 8490:                            ok
 8491:                    end},
 8492:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
 8493:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 8494:                            {ok, ServerSA} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 8495:                            {ok, State#{server_sa => ServerSA}}
 8496:                    end},
 8497: 
 8498:          %% Start the client(s)
 8499:          #{desc => "order client 1 start",
 8500:            cmd  => fun(#{client1   := Pid, 
 8501:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 8502:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {1, ServerSA}),
 8503:                            ok
 8504:                    end},
 8505:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (init)",
 8506:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8507:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client1, init)
 8508:                    end},
 8509:          #{desc => "order client 2 start",
 8510:            cmd  => fun(#{client2   := Pid, 
 8511:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 8512:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {2, ServerSA}),
 8513:                            ok
 8514:                    end},
 8515:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (init)",
 8516:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8517:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client2, init)
 8518:                    end},
 8519:          #{desc => "order client 3 start",
 8520:            cmd  => fun(#{client3   := Pid, 
 8521:                          server_sa := ServerSA} = _State) ->
 8522:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {3, ServerSA}),
 8523:                            ok
 8524:                    end},
 8525:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (init)",
 8526:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8527:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, client3, init)
 8528:                    end},
 8529: 
 8530:          %% The actual test
 8531:          #{desc => "order server continue (accept)",
 8532:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8533:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, accept),
 8534:                            ok
 8535:                    end},
 8536:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8537:          #{desc => "order client 1 continue (connect)",
 8538:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8539:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 8540:                            ok
 8541:                    end},
 8542:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (connect)",
 8543:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8544:                          client1 := Client1,
 8545:                          client2 := Client2,
 8546:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8547:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client1, client1, connect, 
 8548:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8549:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8550:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8551:                            ok
 8552:                    end},
 8553:          #{desc => "order client 2 continue (connect)",
 8554:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8555:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 8556:                            ok
 8557:                    end},
 8558:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (connect)",
 8559:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8560:                          client1 := Client1,
 8561:                          client2 := Client2,
 8562:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8563:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client2, client2, connect, 
 8564:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8565:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8566:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8567:                            ok
 8568:                    end},
 8569:          #{desc => "order client 3 continue (connect)",
 8570:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8571:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, connect),
 8572:                            ok
 8573:                    end},
 8574:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (connect)",
 8575:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8576:                          client1 := Client1,
 8577:                          client2 := Client2,
 8578:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8579:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client3, client3, connect, 
 8580:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8581:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8582:                                              {client2, Client2}]),
 8583:                            ok
 8584:                    end},
 8585:          #{desc => "await server ready (accept from all connections)",
 8586:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8587:                          client1 := Client1,
 8588:                          client2 := Client2,
 8589:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8590:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, accept,
 8591:                                             [{client1, Client1},
 8592:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8593:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8594:                            ok
 8595:                    end},
 8596:          #{desc => "order server continue (recv for all connections)",
 8597:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8598:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, recv),
 8599:                            ok
 8600:                    end},
 8601:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8602:          #{desc => "order client 1 continue (close)",
 8603:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8604:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 8605:                            ok
 8606:                    end},
 8607:          #{desc => "await client 1 ready (close)",
 8608:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8609:                          client1 := Client1,
 8610:                          client2 := Client2,
 8611:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8612:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client1, client1, close, 
 8613:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8614:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8615:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8616:                            ok
 8617:                    end},
 8618:          #{desc => "order client 2 continue (close)",
 8619:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8620:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 8621:                            ok
 8622:                    end},
 8623:          #{desc => "await client 2 ready (close)",
 8624:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8625:                          client1 := Client1,
 8626:                          client2 := Client2,
 8627:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8628:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client2, client2, close, 
 8629:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8630:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8631:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8632:                            ok
 8633:                    end},
 8634:          #{desc => "order client 3 continue (close)",
 8635:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8636:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Pid, close),
 8637:                            ok
 8638:                    end},
 8639:          #{desc => "await client 3 ready (close)",
 8640:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8641:                          client1 := Client1,
 8642:                          client2 := Client2,
 8643:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8644:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client3, client1, close, 
 8645:                                             [{server,  Server},
 8646:                                              {client1, Client1},
 8647:                                              {client2, Client2}]),
 8648:                            ok
 8649:                    end},
 8650:          #{desc => "await server ready (close for all connections)",
 8651:            cmd  => fun(#{server  := Server,
 8652:                          client1 := Client1,
 8653:                          client2 := Client2,
 8654:                          client3 := Client3} = _State) ->
 8655:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Server, server, recv_closed,
 8656:                                             [{client1, Client1},
 8657:                                              {client2, Client2},
 8658:                                              {client3, Client3}]),
 8659:                            ok
 8660:                    end},
 8661: 
 8662:          %% Terminations
 8663:          #{desc => "order client 1 to terminate",
 8664:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8665:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8666:                            ok
 8667:                    end},
 8668:          #{desc => "await client 1 termination",
 8669:            cmd  => fun(#{client1 := Pid} = State) ->
 8670:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8671:                                ok ->
 8672:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client1, State),
 8673:                                    {ok, State1};
 8674:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8675:                                    ERROR
 8676:                            end
 8677:                    end},
 8678:          #{desc => "order client 2 to terminate",
 8679:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8680:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8681:                            ok
 8682:                    end},
 8683:          #{desc => "await client 2 termination",
 8684:            cmd  => fun(#{client2 := Pid} = State) ->
 8685:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8686:                                ok ->
 8687:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client2, State),
 8688:                                    {ok, State1};
 8689:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8690:                                    ERROR
 8691:                            end
 8692:                    end},
 8693:          #{desc => "order client 3 to terminate",
 8694:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = _State) ->
 8695:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8696:                            ok
 8697:                    end},
 8698:          #{desc => "await client 3 termination",
 8699:            cmd  => fun(#{client3 := Pid} = State) ->
 8700:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8701:                                ok ->
 8702:                                    State1 = maps:remove(client3, State),
 8703:                                    {ok, State1};
 8704:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8705:                                    ERROR
 8706:                            end
 8707:                    end},
 8708:          #{desc => "order server to terminate",
 8709:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 8710:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Pid),
 8711:                            ok
 8712:                    end},
 8713:          #{desc => "await server termination",
 8714:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 8715:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Pid) of
 8716:                                ok ->
 8717:                                    State1 = maps:remove(server, State),
 8718:                                    {ok, State1};
 8719:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 8720:                                    ERROR
 8721:                            end
 8722:                    end},
 8723: 
 8724:          %% *** We are done ***
 8725:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 8726:         ],
 8727: 
 8728:     i("start server evaluator"),
 8729:     ServerInitState = InitState,
 8730:     Server = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 8731: 
 8732:     i("start client evaluator(s)"),
 8733:     ClientInitState = InitState#{host => local_host()},
 8734:     Client1 = ?SEV_START("client-1", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8735:     Client2 = ?SEV_START("client-2", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8736:     Client3 = ?SEV_START("client-3", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 8737: 
 8738:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 8739:     TesterInitState = #{server  => Server#ev.pid,
 8740:                         client1 => Client1#ev.pid,
 8741:                         client2 => Client2#ev.pid,
 8742:                         client3 => Client3#ev.pid},
 8743:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 8744: 
 8745:     i("await evaluator"),
 8746:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server,
 8747:                             Client1, Client2, Client3,
 8748:                             Tester]).
 8749: 
 8750: 
 8751: sc_rc_tcp_client_start(Node) ->
 8752:     Self = self(),
 8753:     Fun  = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_client(Self) end,
 8754:     erlang:spawn(Node, Fun).
 8755: 
 8756: 
 8757: sc_rc_tcp_client(Parent) ->
 8758:     sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent),
 8759:     {ServerSA, Proto} = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent),
 8760:     Domain   = maps:get(family, ServerSA),
 8761:     Sock     = sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto),
 8762:     Path     = sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain),
 8763:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, init),
 8764:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, connect),
 8765:     sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA),
 8766:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, connect),
 8767:     sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, close),
 8768:     sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path),
 8769:     sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, close),
 8770:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent),
 8771:     ?SEV_IPRINT("terminate"),
 8772:     exit(Reason).
 8773: 
 8774: sc_rc_tcp_client_init(Parent) ->
 8775:     put(sname, "rclient"),
 8776:     ?SEV_IPRINT("init"),
 8777:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8778:     ok.
 8779: 
 8780: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start(Parent) ->
 8781:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_start -> entry"),
 8782:     ?SEV_AWAIT_START(Parent).
 8783: 
 8784: sc_rc_tcp_client_create(Domain, Proto) ->
 8785:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_create -> entry"),
 8786:     case socket:open(Domain, stream, Proto) of
 8787:         {ok, Sock} ->
 8788:             case socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd) of
 8789:                 {ok, FD} ->
 8790:                     put(sname, ?F("rclient-~w", [FD])); % Update SName
 8791:                 _ ->
 8792:                     ok
 8793:             end,
 8794:             Sock;
 8795:         {error, Reason} ->
 8796:             exit({open_failed, Reason})
 8797:     end.
 8798: 
 8799: sc_rc_tcp_client_bind(Sock, Domain) ->
 8800:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_bind -> entry"),
 8801:     LSA = which_local_socket_addr(Domain),
 8802:     case socket:bind(Sock, LSA) of
 8803:         ok ->
 8804:             case socket:sockname(Sock) of
 8805:                 {ok, #{family := local, path := Path}} ->
 8806:                     Path;
 8807:                 {ok, _} ->
 8808:                     undefined;
 8809:                 {error, Reason1} ->
 8810:                     exit({sockname, Reason1})
 8811:             end;
 8812:         {error, Reason} ->
 8813:             exit({bind, Reason})
 8814:     end.
 8815: 
 8816: sc_rc_tcp_client_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8817:     ?SEV_IPRINT("ready ~w", [Slogan]),
 8818:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan).
 8819: 
 8820: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_continue(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8821:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w continue", [Slogan]),
 8822:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8823: 
 8824: sc_rc_tcp_client_connect(Sock, ServerSA) ->
 8825:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_connect -> entry"),
 8826:     case socket:connect(Sock, ServerSA) of
 8827:         ok ->
 8828:             ok;
 8829:         {error, Reason} ->
 8830:             exit({connect, Reason})
 8831:     end.
 8832: 
 8833: sc_rc_tcp_client_close(Sock, Path) ->
 8834:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_close -> entry"),
 8835:     case socket:close(Sock) of
 8836:         ok ->
 8837:             unlink_path(Path),
 8838:             ok;
 8839:         {error, Reason} ->
 8840:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed closing: "
 8841:                         "~n   Reason: ~p", [Reason]),
 8842:             unlink_path(Path),
 8843:             {error, {close, Reason}}
 8844:     end.
 8845: 
 8846: sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate(Parent) ->
 8847:     i("sc_rc_tcp_client_await_terminate -> entry"),
 8848:     case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, parent) of
 8849:         ok ->
 8850:             ok;
 8851:         {error, Reason} ->
 8852:             Reason
 8853:     end.
 8854: 
 8855: 
 8856: %% The handlers run on the same node as the server (the local node).
 8857: 
 8858: sc_rc_tcp_handler_start(ID, Recv, Sock) ->
 8859:     Self     = self(),
 8860:     Fun      = fun() -> sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Self, Recv, Sock) end,
 8861:     {Pid, _} = erlang:spawn_monitor(Fun),
 8862:     Pid.
 8863: 
 8864: sc_rc_tcp_handler(ID, Parent, Recv, Sock) ->
 8865:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, socket:getopt(Sock, otp, fd), Parent),
 8866:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, recv),
 8867:     RecvRes = sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock),
 8868:     sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, recv, RecvRes),
 8869:     Reason = sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate),
 8870:     exit(Reason).
 8871: 
 8872: sc_rc_tcp_handler_init(ID, {ok, FD}, Parent) ->
 8873:     put(sname, ?F("handler-~w:~w", [ID, FD])),
 8874:     _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Parent),
 8875:     ?SEV_IPRINT("started"),
 8876:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, init),
 8877:     ok.
 8878: 
 8879: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, terminate) ->
 8880:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await terminate"),
 8881:     ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Parent, tester);
 8882: sc_rc_tcp_handler_await(Parent, Slogan) ->
 8883:     ?SEV_IPRINT("await ~w", [Slogan]),
 8884:     ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Parent, parent, Slogan).
 8885: 
 8886: sc_rc_tcp_handler_recv(Recv, Sock) ->
 8887:     ?SEV_IPRINT("recv"),
 8888:     try Recv(Sock) of
 8889:         {error, closed} ->
 8890:             ok;
 8891:         {ok, Data} ->
 8892:             ?SEV_IPRINT("unexpected success: "
 8893:                         "~n   (Unexp) Data: ~p"
 8894:                         "~n   Socket Info:  ~p", [Data, socket:info(Sock)]),
 8895:             {error, unexpected_success};
 8896:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 8897:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive error: "
 8898:                         "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 8899:             ERROR
 8900:     catch
 8901:         error:notsup = Error:Stack ->
 8902:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive ~w error: skip"
 8903:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [Error, Stack]),
 8904:             exit({skip, Error});
 8905:         C:E:S ->
 8906:             ?SEV_IPRINT("receive failure: "
 8907:                         "~n   Class: ~p"
 8908:                         "~n   Error: ~p"
 8909:                         "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 8910:             {error, {recv, C, E, S}}
 8911:     end.
 8912: 
 8913: sc_rc_tcp_handler_announce_ready(Parent, Slogan, Result) ->
 8914:     ?SEV_IPRINT("announce ready"),
 8915:     ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Parent, Slogan, Result),
 8916:     ok.
 8917: 
 8918: 
 8919: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8920: %% This test case is intended to test what happens when a socket is 
 8921: %% remotely closed while the process is calling the recvmsg function.
 8922: %% Socket is IPv4.
 8923: 
 8924: sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 8925:     ?TT(?SECS(30)),
 8926:     tc_try(sc_rc_recvmsg_response_tcp4,
 8927:            fun() -> has_support_ipv4() end,
 8928:            fun() ->
 8929:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8930:                    InitState = #{domain   => inet,
 8931:                                  protocol => tcp,
 8932:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8933:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8934:            end).
 8935:

 8964:            fun() ->
 8965:                    Recv      = fun(Sock) -> socket:recvmsg(Sock) end,
 8966:                    InitState = #{domain   => local,
 8967:                                  protocol => default,
 8968:                                  recv     => Recv},
 8969:                    ok = sc_rc_receive_response_tcp(InitState)
 8970:            end).
